Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O sons, if I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, through its completion in it, and through its expositions and declarations, from my point of view, you will complete that to you with this treatise, which is the part of the operation by hand, and that is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because the operation by hand is neglected in our region and in our time it is deprived of all, while greatly risking the science of it, and its practices are obscured; and nothing remains of it except a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which they distorted and led to errors, and confused the senses of it, and elongated its force and art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it is clear to me that you will enliven that through the ordering of this treatise according to the second way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that it may come with the forms of the tools of cautery and of other instruments of the work as it should be for addition through declaration, and for preparation of it, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the cause why no good artificer is approved by his hand in our time, is because the art of medicine is long, and that its agent must first be exercised in the science of anatomy which recognizes the parts of members and their forms, and their conjunction and separation; and have the knowledge of bones, nerves, and vessels, and the number of these, and their issue; and of the pulsating veins and of the quiet ones, and the places of their issuing.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for that Hyporcas says that although his name is great, in practice it is small, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said of that in the introduction to this book; because whoever is not learned in what we have said of anatomy, is not evacuated so as not to fall into error through which men will die, just as I have seen many of those, because some are formed in this science and they throw themselves away from it without knowledge or experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	Because I saw a foolish and experienced doctor who made an incision on a goiter on the neck of a woman, and he cut some arteries in the neck so that much blood flowed and the woman died in his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who took a stone from a man's gallbladder, and the stone was large, and he took it out with a piece of the bladder, and that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I called to him to stop that, and I saw that through the size of the stone and the disposition of the patient over him that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who received wages from a duke of our land for surgery, and he cured a black slave whose leg was fractured; and through the ignorance of the doctor, he removed the fracture over the wound with powders and splints with strong compression, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And he bound it according to his desires, and he relined it, and he left it for several days, and he commanded that we should not loose the bandage; and so it was as the leg and the thigh became infected with an ulcer, and it came to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I prepared to loose the bandage, and I found rest and ease of his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But nevertheless corruption was confirmed in the member, so that I could not restrain it, and the corruption did not cease to wander through the member until the patient died.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who perforated a cancerous ulcer, and it was open for some days, so that the evil of it increased through its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of which is that the rotten ulcer is pure of melancholic humour, then it does not reach him by iron or anything else, but that it be in a member that suffers so as to be hostile to it.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for that, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation by hand be divided into two divisions: one is an operation associated with health, and the other is work through which there is peril in the major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already discussed that in every place of this book where there is an operation in which there is error and fear; so it is necessary for you to guard against that and leave it, so that the foolish do not stop speaking and disgracing you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And thus take your arms with diligence and the protection of God; and your patients with facility and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the better way through the grace of God so that you may attain health and praiseworthy succession, and lay waste to terrible illnesses of difficult cure; and hold your arms from what makes you fearful, so that trepidation in your faith and name may not escape you: for it remains for your glory, and more beyond in the world and in heaven for your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Galia already said in some of his proverbs:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	“Do not heal illnesses ill, so that evil doctors are not named.”
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book according to three titles.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered from the head to the feet, in the forms of instruments and tools of cauteries, and what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, of cautery and piercing, and of leeches, and of plasters, and of extraction of arrows and of similar things, all titled and ordered in the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, of restoration and of dislocation, and of cure of tortion and of similar things; a chapter ordered from the head to the feet, and of the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cautery with fire and sharp medicine and memory of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of the whole book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I will tell you the quality of those cauteries and of their properties, and in what disposition cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the word of the quality of cautery and the property of it is long and prolix, and subtle through science, and secret hid; and many wise men have spoken much of it, and they disagree on it, and for me enough is a little of their words, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery confers upon every complete disposition universally the which is of matter or without matter, excepting two dispositions, which are caustic dispositions without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the caustic and dry disposition with matter disagreement; for some say that cautery is beneficial to it, and others the contrary of that, that cautery is not convenient in illness which is by quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and convening is that illness caustic and dry is cured by what is cauted and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he says the contrary of that, that by cautery there is benefit in every illness caustic and dry which one sees in the bodies of men, because when you compare the body of man and his humours to the disposition of fire, you find the body of man rubbed.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by the word of that, that experiment it already to me several times have discovered.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But it is not appropriate to come upon this topic one who is inexperienced and un practiced in the chapter of cauteries through posterior exercise, and has not known the diversity of the complexions of men and the disposition of illnesses in their bodies, and their causes, and their accidents, and the span of time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other complexions, do not fear; and especially in moist illnesses, for all doctors have agreed on those, and have not disagreed on the use of cauteries on them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, sons, that the secret of cure by cautery with fire and its goodness, is because fire is simple, whose action does not reach except to the member which is cauterized, and does not affect another member with it except with little harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of burning medicine reaches to those in members from which it is distant, and strongly brings the illness into the member with difficult cure, and strongly increases it.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, by its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does not do that except to cause superfluousness. And it is known to us through experience and through the length of service of study on the truth of causes; and because of this I am excused from the length of speech. And if it were not that I am not read in your presence in this pauserer, a secret hid by fire, and the quality of the operation of it in bodies and of its expulsion through which you expel illnesses, by philosophical speech demonstrated, which would be acute in your feet.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, sons, that they disagree on the time when it is convenient to do cautery and pause the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is convenient in all times, so that the damage by the accidental time is submerged in the improvement of what is drawn by cautery, and especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong and fiery, which do not endure delay because it is feared of those who come to wickedness, which is greater than little harm coming by time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And thus do not cut into your feet, or sons, that which is not considered except by the common people and foolish doctors; it is because to that illness which is healed by cautery there is not a reduction of all time, and they pause that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not because they think it; for cautery is only in place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries up the moisture, which are caused so that pains come.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But cautery is superfluous over medicine by the will of its strength and power, and greatness of his lordship.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that his illness returns at some time of the year, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of his illness, and its strength, and that which is prepared in his body from the accumulation of superfluities in him, and that which has come to him in his acquisition in foods and likenesses of those causes; but that the illness on which cautery was administered is subtle illness in a member of few superfluities and moisture, thus like cautery of a tooth for pain and likeness, it is possible that this pain does not return in him, but that is done in small ones.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And yet the vulgar speech is that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a right speech, not so that they understand it in it, for they believe there is no cure which profits by medicine or other cause except cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is in contrary to that; and the intention that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is only when we administer the methods of cure in certain illnesses, and those medicines do not confer it, and yet at the end of the cause a man is administered cautery, and profits from it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And then from here cut that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the intention which the vulgar and foolish doctors understand it.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they said the ancients that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say it except for the equality of gold and sublimity of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cautery does not do heat, when it is not absolutely true; for I have seen and proved that it does only in some bodies without the others, and cautery with that is good and better than with iron as they said; but when you do cautery with fire with gold, it is not declared to you, because it is heated according to the quantity that you will by the redness of the gold, and prepares to receive heat; and if you apply over it ignition, the gold melts into the fire, and drops some sheets so that the artificer cuts off by the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And therefore cautery is done with iron we must lightly and more closely to rectitude of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and have ordered those of the head within the feet, so that they ask from him what he wants of it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for pain in the head for coldness and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter:
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery confers with moisture and coldness about the superficial accident of which it is two causes, so is cause of soda and multitude of fluxes, called corissa, from the parts of the ears and the auricles and flowing, and multitude of sleep, and pain of teeth, and of goiter, and generally of all illnesses that come by coldness, thus with paralysis, apoplexy, and likeness in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is that first of all you command the patient to be evacuated by laxative medicine of the head purging, for three or four days, according to the strength of the patient and his age and custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him that he shaves his head with a razor, and then let him lie between your knees on a low bench, and let him rest his feet on you.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then pause the edge of your palm close to the nose between the eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But yet, when the point of the middle part is reached, sign that place with a tent, and then heat the cautery olive of which this is the form.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then pause it over the point marked by the tent, in such manner that the hand be stretched little by little, and you revolve him.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand lightly and look at the place, and if you see already some part of the head discovered, as well as any amount of bones, then lift your hand again, and if it does not return to you with that iron, with another one, if it is cooled off, between while be seen by you what I have said.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it on the place and let him lick that for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then pause over it cloth drenched in vinegar and let him lick that over while the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the place with four-ingredient ointment, so that it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they said that when the Roman plaster is open, as many meals give heat, for it is better and more healing.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they said some of them that the jaw be cauterized within the bone, and it is held the cautery within while some part of the substance of the bone is burned.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then let him lick that which is burnt in the bone, and then let it be cured.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	Others say that when the cautery reaches the bone it produces a strong impression on it, and that this is the way to treat small ulcers.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that the vapors of the head are expelled from that place.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if a wound is left open for a long time, it should be treated until it is healed and consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two species of cautery at all, except in some men according to the way of fear; and that which leaves, by my opinion, is better for health when it is; because the head is devitalized by solution of continuity in it also as we have testified in other members, and mainly when the head of the patient is of a phlegmatic nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the species of the first cautery is more safe and better by my opinion; and with it we use and act for health.
Capitol segon.	Chapter second.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in all the head there happens chronic and long pain and this is prolonged in the patient, and he uses herbs and clysters and caput medusae and plasters and cataplasms and lances and poultices and hot stones and similar remedies, and mainly if he has already been cauterized with a cautery which we recount and does not benefit him any of those causes, then consider that if the head of the patient is of strong creation in its nature; and it is phlegmatic and finds great heat, then cauterize with another cautery after that one a little.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that above the horn of his head with a cautery until the membrane is split.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	The membrane being split and the quantity which we have recounted being discovered from the bone, cauterize that with a cautery in the posterior part of the head in the place which is called vas, — and it is that place in which the cupping-glass is applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And hold your hand over that, and do not discover the bone, because the patient by that finds much greater pain than from the pain of all the other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I say to apply this cautery in its place, because the cautery with which you cauterize the horns of the head and the occiput is a more subtle cautery than that with which the middle part of the head is cauterized; and it is applied as follows:
Capitol ters.	Chapter third.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of cautery of not antique emigration.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When suddenly in the anterior part of the head there is a painful swelling, or the pain extends to the eye, evacuate the head with purging medicines, and administer the other cure, which I have described in the chapters on diseases; and if all does not benefit, cautery is applied to it in two ways: either cautery with an acute medicine burning, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But cautery with a burning medicine is that you take an almond, and scorch it and rub the ends of it on both sides of the head.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then pierce the place of the pain in the temple with a pointed lance until it is made in it beneath the membrane, as far as it can be felt.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then press on it with a bandage tightly bound, and leave that for the space of three hours; and then remove the bandage and treat the almond, and let the wound for two or three days, and then apply to it oil sprinkled with alum as far as the place makes blisters.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with an ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you will, do this with some burning medicines which I have written in the two tractates of burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But the cautery with iron is done according to this way: heat an iron cautery of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called claus clavilis, because the head of it is like the form of a nail in which there is some curve, and in the middle part of it is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then apply it to the place of the pain, and hold your hand — so that the cautery which is beneath is not touched — and move the iron little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of it that is burned by the thickness of the membrane as far as the size of it, and raise your hand so that the artery which is beneath is not touched, so that there does not come a flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then moisten a cloth in salt water and apply it to the place, and leave that for three days; and then apply a cloth moistened with wine, and cure with an ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you will, cauterize with the point of the scalpel according to the cautery, and beware of incision of artery in this not antique emigration properly.
Capitol quart.	Chapter fourth.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of cautery of antique emigration.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you cure emigration with what we have said of the cure preceding, and what we have said in the chapters on diseases, and the cure does not benefit, and you see in the disease that it does not suffice to it what we have said of the first cautery with medicine or of the cautery with fire, then when you ignite the cautery cutler until it is whitened, then indicate over the place of the pain with a line of length of which is the size of the digit, or as much as that; and laying your hand by one side, and piercing it into the artery and coming to the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However it is necessary to you that you guard against the continuation of the jaw, which is injured because of mastication, and that the ligament not be burned and the nerve which hurts that, and that no spasm come upon it.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and care of flow of blood from the artery which is incised, because in the incision of it there is danger, and mainly to him who ignores what he does and is inexperienced and unskilful; and let the operation begin in that place.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come with remembrance of the regimen of flow of blood from the artery according to his manner, in that free space.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see of this disease that it does not suffice this cautery and see the body of the patient tolerable, cauterize that in the middle part of the head as we have recounted, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you will administer the cautery which we have said in the chapter of incision of artery with cautery having two points, and this cautery is better and more suitable.
Capitol .v.	Chapter fifth.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of cautery of pains of ears.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain from friction and it is cured with lactic causes and with the other cure which I have said in the chapter, and the pain is not relieved, then ignite the cautery, and this is the one which has the name puncta, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then puncture it with the point and carry it around the whole ear as it is turned, or in the circuit of whichever part if the pain is in whichever.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Long it with the cautery of the edge of the ear few by few until you feel the place with touch.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery of ten points in all the ear, and those around it, and then cure the places until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter sixth.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of cautery of torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture which is cured and by cautery is not excepted from the remedies which come through phlegm, according to what we have said in the chapters on diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cautery of the part that hurts due to dryness or due to a spasm in the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat this kind of torture with potions and bloodletting and poultices, and your treatment does not help, then you should cauterize the patient with three cauteries: in the first place, you must cauterize the root of the auricle; in the second place, a small cautery below the temple; and in the third place, you must cauterize the junction of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And apply your cautery on the side that hurts, because softening only comes to the part that appears to be healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the way to do cauterization is that you must cauterize the auricle on the right side of its upper extremity a little above the horn of the head, and another one in the temple, the length of which should be according to the length of the finger toenail; and you must apply your hand with the cautery until half of the thickness of the cord is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of cauterization, and it is a specific of the cutler, the shape of which is like a table knife.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But indeed more subtle is that one a little bit so; and it is necessary to cut in him of superficial grossness a little bit.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the place with what is before prepared until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter .VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of cautery of ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and you treat it with what we have said, and your medication does not help, and the patient has no fever, then you should cauterize him with four cauteries: over all the horns of his head; and with a cautery on the middle part of the head, as we have said before; and with a cautery in the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the way to do cauterization is done according to what is above said.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it is cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; and it is more behind; and then it should be treated with what is prepared.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter .VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of cautery of oblivion made by flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	And you should give the patient at the beginning large potions and purgative pills.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then scrape the whole head of the patient and apply on the neck of him plaster of cedar described in the treatise of plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply that some times, for that is the way to do cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do that according to that medicine which I have said before.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if he is healed by that well, and if not, then do to him three cauteries in the back part of his head, which descend from the uppermost part of the head to the lower part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And pause between each cautery the thickness of a finger, and then treat the cautery with what is prepared.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you see that he can tolerate it and the patient is that strong, then do to him cautery in the middle part; and if you see greater strength, then do cauterization on both horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat that until it is healed; and let the cautery be olive oil according to the form before given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter .IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cauterization of hernia and of softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	And you should process cleansing of the head with potions and with what we have said; and then scrape the head of the patient, and then cauterize him with cautery in the middle part of the head, and with cautery on all the horns of the head, and with cautery on the back part of him, and with three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the softening of the body of hernia and the patients tolerate it, and the illness is strong, then do to him four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and lastly with cautery until half of the thickness of the cord is burned, and lift up your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then treat that until it is healed, and let this be olive oil cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter .X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized except that epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And then cleanse the brain of him at the beginning with herbs and with the other treatment which we have said in the division when the patient is big and can tolerate the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not endure medicines, then administer poultices and masticators the servant cleansings, before for several days, with the benefit of foods.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then scrape the head of the patient, and then cauterize him with a cautery in the middle part of the head according to the previous way, and with another cautery on the back part of his head, and on each horn of his head you must cauterize.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and can tolerate it, then do to him cauteries which I have said, having paralysis and softening of the body on the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let the cautery be olive oil according as it is before.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then apply subtle cautery according to this way.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter .XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupt humidities and phlegm, then do to him cauteries which we have said in having paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excess phlegm declining into melancholy, and the body of the patient is cold, then give to him to drink what cleanses the brain of him according as it has been said in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then scrape the head of the patient, and then make a decently made sponge of lye on the circle, and then apply it in the middle part of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient must be lying down, and he must hold his entire body.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply linen; and it is also worthy of lamb's wool.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat that over the fire with moderate warmth by measure, which the patient can endure when he is in him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then apply it in the middle part of the head in the circle, and wash it when it is cool.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do that to him once every week for one day, and let him have the other regimen of him well until it is healed; or if you want, cauterize him making small points according as he can endure them, except that you must hold your hand over a cautery in this way arranged: this is a specific cautery which softens the brain with equality.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that cut part in a bath of warm water or in a bowl of rosewater.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of cauterization with descending water.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have observed the beginning of water in the head through the signs which I mentioned in the division, then begin and give to the patient something to drink that cleanses his head, and guard him against all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let him bathe in warm water for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then command him to wash his hair, and cauterize that with a cautery in the middle of the head; and also cauterize that with two cauteries over the temples if it is the beginning of water in both ears, or on one side if the water begins in one ear.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cut with a cautery all the veins and arteries that are under the collarbone; and the cauteries should be in that length in the breadth of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And guard against bleeding when it is cauterized; and if you see any bleeding from him, stop it with some medicine which is possible for you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come with wisdom which is in the extraction of arteries and with abstention from those and cauterization to prevent bleeding.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized in the nape under two bones with two cauteries recently produced.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears from the ears are long-standing and persistent, and through the veins and arteries which are in the most obvious location on the head, it is verified that this is an excess of phlegmatic moisture, then cauterize that with a cautery which we have recounted in the chapter on the beginning of water coming into the ears, and with a cautery in the middle of the head, and with two cauteries on the nape under two temples, and with two cauteries on the nape under two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you see any discharge of matter, then cauterize that in every part of the ear canal at the end of the upper jaw with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of cauterization for fetor of the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you are treating someone with what we have said in the division and your treatment does not prove beneficial, then prepare and give the patient enemas for three nights; and then shave his head, and cauterize that with a cautery made of olive oil.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And also cauterize that with a cautery of cloves with two cauteries over the two upper jaws under the hair, a little one.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And guard against the artery so that you do not ignite it.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And of the cautery of cloves this is the form.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cauterization for softening eyelids of the ears.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the ear is softened by sickness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with one cautery with this cautery of the moon; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you wish, cauterize that over the two upper lids a little with two cauteries all around, and they should be elongated from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the amount of the eyelid.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but according to how much the upper part of the eyelid is swollen.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of cauterization for the eyelid of the ear when hairs have become ingrown and pierce the inside and poke the ear.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the ear become ingrown so that they pierce the inside and poke the ear, there are two ways to cauterize them, either with a cautery of iron or with a cautery of burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you cauterize it with fire, command the patient to wash his hair so that he does not hurt himself when he cuts off those hairs, until they are long and smooth; and if the ear is punctured by them, then strengthen his ears with a bandage so that he is not hurt as the hairs grow.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Thus when they grow and are smooth, then put the patient's head in the warm water, and then sign on the eyelid of the ears with a mark, a sign which is according to the figure of a dead leaf, and let the beginning of that sign be near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then put paste made with white vinegar or mullein on the ear.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then ignite the cautery of which this is the form:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize over the figure which you have marked, bit by bit, in small circles, until the surface of the collarbone is burnt up which is as it were with a myrrh leaf, all appearing properly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And the sign of health of your work is that you see the eyelid of the ear already contracted and the hairs of it raised above the puncture of the ear.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then lift your hand and let him go for three days, and then put on him paste made with oil until the scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if they return for any reason and the eyelid is softened, then do again the cautery on that all around as you did at first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are under the eyelid, then cauterize that until it is raised to its natural place and is smooth and the hairs do not poke the ear.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine is that you command the patient to wash the hairs until they are long and smooth, and then let the cautery be made of linen in the form of a myrrh leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take some boiled lye and live coal mixed with it. And you shall take some boiled lye and live coal mixed with it. You shall take that mixture and add to it some live coal, and make that into a poultice so that it is not cold; and then spread that on the cloth which is made as the form of a myrrh leaf, and put that on one or both ears; and let the patient's head be in the warm water, and his hair in its natural position.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And hold the cloth over the medicine and press it gently so that the patient does not feel the biting of the medicine, for the biting is in him as with fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And when you perceive that the biting has ceased, then take away the medicine and wash the ear with water; and then consider if you see the eyelid raised as it is washed or as a result of being bound up with fire or with an incision, for then it will be well; and if it returns over that on which the medicine did not work its effect and does not darken until your operation is healed and the ear contracted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then put on it paste made with vinegar of wine or with another ointment until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, after your operation that you watch with great diligence that no pus comes from the ear, and if the eyelid after several days is softened and some cause of the hairs poking in the ear, then repeat your medicine on that location of the eyelid which is softened, and particularly as you did at the beginning, and bandage him up until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of a myrrh leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the bodies of men are diversified according to size and smallness, and therefore according to this is made your contraction.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	Nor is it hidden from those who follow this path that it is studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter .xvii.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cauterization of a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you are treating a fistula and have not had success with what we have said in the divisions of diseases, then you must cauterize it as follows: order the patient to put his head on your lap, and have someone else hold the patient's head still between their knees so that he doesn't move or shake his head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then place a cotton wad soaked in vinegar or in a poultice of poppies over the tear duct.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And heat the cautery, of which this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which must be hollow, as it is shaped like a reed or a pen made of vulture feathers, from one end of which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it may extend into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, it can go out like a tent.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But that which is hollow is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And press the fistula if it is open and draw out from it pus and dry it up.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the rottenness from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And apply the cautery, which should be well heated, to the eye at the start of the nose so that your hand does not tremble or the patient become disturbed, and then apply the cautery to the edges of the tear duct and corrupt it there.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the beginning of your cautery it pierces into the bone, that is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice as necessary, and leave it there for three days, and apply a poultice of dry powder over it until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if eleven days have passed and it has not healed, then apply a corroding acute medicine so that the bone is uncovered and scrape it according to what is convenient in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another way to cauterize a fistula which some first said: enter the site of the fistula and open it and then place in that fissure a subtle bed of which its shape is as follows: melt an ounce of lead into it; and hold your hand steady with good control so that the patient does not move, and do not let the melted lead reach the eye of the patient; and place over the eye of the patient a cotton wad soaked in vinegar or water, for the lead will adhere to the site of the fistula and heal it by a wonderful cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed by what we have said about cautery and cure, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to apply a tracheotomy and reduce the fistula in the nose according to what comes into its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter .xviii.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of cautery of the split of the ear.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times fissures occur in the lips and mostly in children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fissures with what we have said in the divisions and your cure is not effective, then heat a small cautery knife according to this shape that it fits into the fissure:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And its cavity should be according to the thinness of the blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then apply it carefully into those fissures so that the cautery reaches the depth of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that with ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter .xix.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cautery of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or on the palate or on the roots of the teeth there is an abscess and it becomes swollen, and when it is burst, and when it is old, and is corroded, and a fistula is made, and you cure that and your cure is not effective, then know that you should heat cauteries according to the amount that is received in the fistula, and then apply the hot cautery into the opening of the fistula, and hold your hand so that the iron reaches the depth of it, and do this once or twice; and heal that with what we have said about cure until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so if the pus is discharged and it is healed, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to uncover the site and scrape off the rottenness according to what comes into its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter .xx.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cautery of teeth and of softening of ulcers.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the ulcers are softened by moisture and the teeth are shaken, and you cure those with medicines and your cure is not effective, then have the patient hold his head in your lap, and heat the cautery of which its shape will come next, so that you apply the poultice over the tooth and insert into it the hot cautery quickly, and hold your hand steady so that the patient feels the heat of the fire on the root of the tooth from which it is coming.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift up your hand and repeat the cautery several times according to what you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should gargle with salt water and keep it in his mouth for an hour, and then spit it out, for the shaken tooth is made firm, and the soft gum is made strong, and the rottenness is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter .xxi.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of cautery of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is from coldness, or in it is aching or green, or the cure does not work with medicine, then the cautery on it is according to two methods: either cautery with cow's dung, or cautery with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with dung is that you take cow's dung and boil it in a pot made of iron, and then pick up a piece of cloth and wrap it around the end of the needle, and then dip that in the hot dung and apply it quickly to the aching tooth so that it becomes cold.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat that several times until the strength of the fire reaches the roots of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, dip wool or cloth in the dung above, and apply it to the tooth that hurts, and place over that hot iron so that the iron reaches the depth of the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But the cautery with fire is that you take a needle of iron or of steel, and there is in it some thickness and the acuteness of the fire does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then heat the cautery of which its shape will come, and apply it to the tooth and hold your hand so that the cautery is cold; and do that several times because the pain usually remains or in that day or in the other day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And know that by force of that cautery that the patient fills his mouth with good breath and keeps it for an hour, then spit it out, and this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And you cauterize by which you see the end according to what is possible to you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the needle:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of cautery of excrescences.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When excrescences are of phlegm and of cold humors and they do not yield to digestion with medicines and you see the digestion of those slightly, then heat a cautery whose shape is as follows: having two ends hollow so that smoke comes out from the cautery through one end, and apply it ignited over the excrescence once, and if you need, then repeat it, until it reaches the depth of the excresence.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the boil is small, then apply the cautery according to the size of the boil, and let it burn for three days, and place a poultice on it made from boiled oatmeal, until what the fire has burnt is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	Then treat this with ointment and bandages and linen until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the cautery or needle should be such as to suit the purpose.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterization of any wound and of constriction of a vein.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity comes upon the gullet of the lung, and especially when it is caused by coldness of complexion, then the patient should first be evacuated with laxative medicines, and then the root of the gullet cauterized in the affected place.
