Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore when this happens to someone, you should close it with your hand over the opening of the artery, and place your thumb over that place, and press it tightly with your fingers so that the flow of blood is stopped under your thumb, and it does not come out.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	Then place on the fire the olive-oil cauteries, a few and large, several times, and blow over them so that they are set alight.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take one of those small or large according to the site and the plague in which the artery is broken, over that vein quickly so that you have stopped the flow of blood with your thumb, and do cautery on it until it is bound and restricted.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood flows from the opening of the artery when you release your thumb and loosen the cautery, then take another cautery which has been prepared in the fire, and do this repeatedly until the blood is restricted.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And be careful that you do not burn the nerve which is here, and that it does not come upon the patient any other harm.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when blood flows from an artery, it is not possible to restrict the blood in those except by one of four ways: or by cautery as we have said, or by extraction if it is not extracted, for when it is extracted its extremities are burnt and the blood is restricted; or that it be bound with a ligature or with a bandage by strong constriction, or that medicines which have the virtue to restrict the blood be placed upon him and bound with a compress by decent constriction.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But he who administers decent restriction of him with a bandage and constriction with cloth or by position of causes burning and similar, does not confer but tar.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if this happens to someone and the doctor is not present nor medicine, then open by placing your thumb over the opening of that vein as we have said, and understand at the great constriction of him until the blood is stopped from the principal part of the plague; and on the artery let there be no flow of blood; and from the artery sprinkle with water rubbed with something greatly rubbing until the blood is congealed and thickened; and unless cautery or medicine is necessary.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begins the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision, and puncturing, and opening, and phlebotomy, and of plagues and their equivalents.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter all sickness which is appropriate with cautery and with burning medicine, and their occasions and causes, and the instruments in which they are necessary and the forms of the cauteries; and we have ordered the chapters from the upper part of the head to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And now we will go through that medical way so that it may be lightened for the patient, then upon that which he has demanded.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before we begin that, know that in this chapter it is for terror that which is in the first chapter of cautery.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And be careful that it is in him great caution, for in the operation which is in this chapter many times there is a certain evacuation which is with blood through which life is lost by aspersing the vein or incision on the ulcer or opening of an abscess or purification of a plague or extraction of arrow or incision of stone and their equivalents.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And from all these accompany fear and trembling and in the mass of them death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that this does not fall upon you in which there is hesitation, for some times case happens to men by many ways of sickness.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And of them some are sent away by their sickness and is the weakness because of it that signifies death; and for the length of his sickness and by the sickness itself, and it is fear which means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of those is who gives to you his son or daughter, you expecting from him health, and his sickness is hurtful.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore do not consent to anyone who comes to you in this way; and your caution be greater than naivety and your greediness; and do not presume any cause upon that unless proper certain science which verifies that for you, and to whom is possible laudable success.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the cure of all your sicknesses from prediction and indication of him to whom health is converted; for in him there is help concerning acquisition of fame and memory, praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	O sons, God inspires you understanding and do not turn away from you direction and protection; for it is in his hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have ordered this chapter distinguishing by chapters according to what precedes in the chapter of cauteries, from the cure of the head to the feet, so that it may be lightened for you that which you demanded and of which you have need.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the cure of water which is contained in the heads of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this sickness sometimes happens to children because of pregnancy and when the nurse tightens the head of the infant she feels it.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And some times by hidden cause which is not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have not seen this sickness except in children; and to all those whom I have seen it happens death, and for this I have seen evident work in them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen that one child whose head was of water, and his head was always magnified so that nurse could not lift him up by the size of his head; and but that humidity was increased within which fire caused death.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	This moisture or is aggregated between the tendon and bone, or is aggregated below the bone on the head.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	Because the operation in that if the moisture is between the tendon and the bone and the ulcer is small, then cover what you split in the middle of the head with a poultice in the width, and let the length of the poultice be six digits between which the moisture runs, and this is the form of the spatula:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And therefore if the moisture is more increased and the ulcer is larger, then there are here two slits according to this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the moisture is below the bone, its sign is that you see the edges of the head opened wide and the water is squeezed out when you compress that with your hand to the openings inside, and it is not hidden from you.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Cover what you split in the middle of the head with three slits according to this manner:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	and then extract all the moisture; and then strengthen the slits with bandages and plasters; and then anoint it from above with wine and oil on the fifth day, and then loosen the bandage and heal the wound with ointments and dressings, and strengthen the head with equality; and feed the patient with dry food of little moisture until the member is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another manner of incision, which considers where the magnitude of the ulcer and the collection of water appear, for some appear more in the occipital region, or in the front part, or on the right side, or on the left; and therefore pay attention to the incision where the ulcer appears and the collection of water, and do it according to how you consider it most possible.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you do not cut the artery and cause a flow of blood and kill the patient through that flow of blood by the evacuation of moisture.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of the incision of the arteries which are near the ears, called auricles.
Capitol segon.	Chapter II.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When there is a catarrh or swelling in the ears or the feet, and it is ancient, and there is no response to the treatment of medicines, then the last treatment for this is the incision of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore cover when you want to cut those which the patient's head passes through, and then wipe the place with a rough cloth so that the arteries appear, and then be bound around the neck of the patient with some cloth; and then consider where the pulse is; and the places of each over the places which are near the ears pressed down, and they are hidden except in some people.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then mark on the artery with a tent, and then cut each one with the spatula of each part made with an incision penetrating into the bone, and let it be through the width of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you want, insert the spatula below the artery and pierce that to the parts beneath, and those above are incident to the parts above.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And let the length of the incision be six digits apart, for when any vein is cut the blood flows out with a pulsating egress, and that salt jumps out frequently.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear to the pulse, then cover from the auricle the quantity of the space of three digits, and then mark with tent, and do it penetrating into the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And that which comes out of the blood is quantity of wine ounce. and strongly he comes out of him more or less, and all that is according to the quantity which appears from the virtue of the patient and the collection of the artery from him.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then consider the wound, and therefore if any cause of the head remains on the bone, then cut it so that no cauterized ulcer comes from it.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen the wound with plasters and with bandages of linen cloth, and then heal that with ointments until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Of the extraction of the arteries which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When to someone there happens migrain ancient or catarrhs caused, by humoral avarice and by quality in the lacerts of the temples, or ancient fever violent and similar to those, and is medicated with the manners of healing of medicine and that does not respond, then we have shown in these illnesses extraction of the arteries in the temples, or cauterization of those also as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the manner of the operation and extraction of those is that the patient passes through the temples; and understand the artery which appears in the temple because it is shown to you by its pulse, and it is hidden except in few people by strength of wiping.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden from you, then be bound around the neck of the patient with some cloth; and then wipe the place with a rough cloth or evaporate the place with hot water until you appear to you the artery manifestly.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then you take the spatula of which this is the form:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then you scrape the tendon with that with ease until you come to the artery; and then cut in it and extract it into the parts above until you extract it from the tendon and discover it from the tunics which are below it, of all parts.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is slender, then wrap that with the tip of the finger, and then cut one part according to the quantity by which they are lengthened and shortened, and there will not be a flow of blood, for if they are not cut the blood cannot flow out at all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then evacuate the blood of wine ounce. into three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then cover that in two places with strong woolen felt or cords on length, and do not cut to it putrefaction before the consolidation of the wound and let there be a flow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then cut the superfluity which is between two bandages; and do that in that hour or another hour.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you want, cauterize that with cautery into the bone with cautery knife within which they are cut the ends of it, and be in place of that meteyssa work.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is better work unless the patient has fever or is of heated complexions, for cautery is of those causes that help the ending humors, and therefore is better in youth.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then cover the extraction of the arteries that appear to the place of ancient ulcer, and be laid upon it powders made decently, and then let it be healed with dry medicines making a poultice and with hot water until it is healed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while you work another view happens to flow of blood from the artery, then you tie that blood, or with cautery, or scrape the place of ulcer, and strengthen your hand within until it is restricted the blood.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if any cause of those is not to you present, then pause your finger on the place within which the blood is coagulated, and moisten the place with hot water of violent frictions until the keenness rests, and be bound according to how it is covered.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And that which is pus earlier in the extraction of artery is that you cauterize the vein with this cautery having two points, because you have marked the two places with tent, and removed each other, burning fire, within which they come to the bone and cut the vein in two places so that it is elongated that which is between the ends of it, for they are not consolidated at all with this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery instrument:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	The sharpness of both ends should be the same.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	However, if one end is slightly sharper than the other, it's better, for when both ends are close to each other and not pressing into the flesh with great force.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	So, if there is any thickness in those areas, the heat of the fire should be held there and the flesh should be cut away gently.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this is better than all other operations and less painful.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And the distance between the two ends should be equal to the thickness of a finger.
Capitol quart.	Chapter four:
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the treatment of acute and acidic wounds in the bowels.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When they are acidic wounds and the source is veins that are above the forehead, and there is no cause for the cure with medicine, and you see the patient's face becoming red and feeling crawling like ants in his forehead, and his bowels are weakened, moistened in such a way that their skin is known to be familiar with it, and the eyelids are burned by the acidity of the tears, the old ones apply a cure with a sponge.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you command the patient to scratch the skin on his forehead, and then gently insert into his forehead three parallel incisions according to the length of his forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the incision is two fingers: the first incision should be equally distant according to the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead, and the second according to the length of a little less than the movement of the tears that are in the tear gland, and the third from the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And be careful of the incisions on both sides, and extend your hand from the continuation of both mandibles.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	If the space between each incision is equal to three fingers side by side.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a sponge apparatus or dry rags with which to stop the bleeding.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then insert the spatula from both acute ends, of which this is the shape of the incision of it:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	that is from the start of the temples into the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Excavate with it all the flesh that is between two incisions, using the skull as a guide which is above the bone, and then do the same with the middle incision into the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then press it with this spatula and insert into the first incision again, but this time with another instrument called a cutlass, sharp on one side and blunt on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And press the sharp side of it against the flesh attached to the bone, and the other side against the bone, and insert it into the middle incision, and cut away with it all the vessels that descend from the head to the bowels.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	But let the incision continue until it reaches the bone, and then do the same with the middle incision into the other incision.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And then when the blood flows in equal quantity, squeeze out the places of the clotted blood.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then place in each incision a piece of old cotton wool, and place over them powders mixed with wine and oil and sour wine, so that no pus develops into an ulcer.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day loosen the bandages and administer copious fomentations of warm water or tea, and then cure it with basilicon ointment made with rose oil and others so that the wounds are healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter five:
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	On the treatment of wounds by cauteries and bowels descending from the parts inside the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When to someone come cauteries and continuant, and you see the bowels of the patient weakened small, and then the guarding of them is debilitated, and the eyelids are ulcerated and their skin is blackened, and in the temple of the head there is acute pain and consequent tension, then understand from these accidents that the matters and cauteries do not come except from certain veins proceeding from inside.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure for these is this: command the patient to raise his forehead, and then insert into it an incision in the middle of the forehead, a little by the width (and begin with the incision of the left temple into the right temple; and let the incision be into the bone; and extend your hand from the tears of the temples which are hurt because of chewing), so that the bone is uncovered.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry up all the blood with a sponge or dry cloth, and then stuff between the two lips of the incision with old cotton wool or dry lint.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then press upon it powders mixed with wine and oil, so that no pus develops into an ulcer.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you remove it and see that the ulcer has diminished, then know that the friction of the bone caused it to come out, and then cure it with an astringent remedy which makes the flesh come out, as if you take flour from wheat two parts and gum four parts and mix them, and from this make a plaster and apply it to these wounds of the flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter six:
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the treatment of what bites in the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The whole cause that bites in the ears is one of four species, for it is either mineral stone or similar to stone like iron and glass, or it is plant as if it were chervil or bean, or it is volatile cause as water and sour wine and their likes.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And then when stone bites in the ear or another cause like those causes that do not increase in the ear, and put the ear to the sun, and if you see the stone, then distill into it some cause of violets oil or sesame, and then administer its extract, and make him sneeze with medicine, and dry up his nose because of sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then put around the ear some pieces of cloth or wool, and extend the ear to its sides, for many times it is torn by these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not torn, then administer its extract with the instrument called extremely subtle curved forceps, of which this is the shape:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is torn by gesti, let it be; and if not, then administer its extract with a very subtle sharp pair of forceps.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And then if it is not torn by that, make a tube of iron and insert the end of the tube into the hole of the ear and close the opening of the tube with wax and with softened oil so that nothing comes out except the tube.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract it with a strong pull, for often things are pulled along with it which we have encountered before.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not torn in this way, take holly ash or of venice alumbak, by which the ears are pressed a little quantity, and put that on the end of the ray, and then wrap around it a decent amount of bandage.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the hole of the ear with ease, and then dry up the ear from moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And then if it is not torn by all the causes which we have recounted, then you cut to such an extent that which comes out ulcer or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the way to cut it is that you first draw the blood of the patient from the vein sephasic and extract the blood according to the manner of the nature of it, and then do it cescere between your hands and turn the ear to its sides, and open a little fissure in the root of the ear because of the grey matter in the place where it is premeditated by you.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And let the incision be made in the shape of a moon so that it reaches the stone, and when the stone is found, obstruct it with instruments if possible; and then close the incision quickly at that time, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause of the pain in the ear is a growth that has grown and become inflated, then administer treatment and extract it; but if it does not obey you on its own, then take a thin spatula according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer to it the incision of that growth which has fallen into the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do this when you think that it has already been moistened by the vapor of the ear, and put it in a few drops, and extract it from those with tweezers or with a subtle gesture, or with an incision as we have said, for the extraction of it is eased.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But with the water which has entered the ear, let the patient sneeze with the intention of causing it to come out at the beginning, and fill his ear with some old cotton, and spit upon that ear in which is the water, and if by this means it is expelled, well; and if not, take some thin stones and heat them according to the length of the finger, and warm those in the fire a little, and let the patient insert one of those into the hole of his ear and suck on it with another stone over the stone which is within the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore, do not cease this until all the water is expelled.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when the water has been expelled in that way that you took from paper or from a cloth, take one end of it and insert it into the ear and extend the other end with fire until its middle is burned.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	Then insert another cloth and do this as many times until all the water is expelled, and use that with a cannula as it has been said about the stone extractor.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extraction of an insect that has entered the ear, if it is small, use the same as we have said about the stone; but if it is a large thing that causes the pain in the ear, then administer its extraction with tools and tweezers, and the cause of this is pus more than all other causes that enter the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of a worm generated in the ear, when you are treating it with what we have said in the division and in the treatise on distillation and you do not find your treatment effective, then look at the ear towards the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And so if you see any cause of the worm, then extract it with tools or with subtle tweezers; but if you do not see any cause, then take a cannula below which is narrow and above which is ample, and this is its form:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the slender end into the ear according to the amount which the patient can endure; and then suck it with a strong suction, and do this several times until all the worms are expelled.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if it does not obey you on its own, then plug and close the circuit of the cannula with wax as we have said; then administer distillation which the ancients have already tried in the treatment of worms, and find this in the treatise on distillation.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let your effusion with which you pour the medical oils into the ear be with this instrument of which this is the form:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make it of silver or brass, below which is narrow and above which is flat.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And so it is with the embossing that it is in the cavity of the cannula from which what is necessary will be contained.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you want, take the rod and wrap it in a cloth at its slender end, and then pour oil into the cavity of the instrument or suck juice from some herb, or anything that you want from these medicines into the cannula — and this is in the ear — and then insert the rod with a cloth above and squeeze it with your hand that compressed it until the oil is expelled into the cavity of the instrument and the patient feels the oil inside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what has been put in the ear shall already be warmed by fire a little.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And beware that the cause which you distill in the ear is not too hot, for the medicines of the ear do not endure that.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of the treatment of the inflammation of ears.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some children are born with hernias from the bellies of their mothers, and this happens in some men; inflammation in the middle of the ear is caused by a hernia or by some wound to that part, and sometimes it is in the openings of the holes.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And what happens in the middle, which does not include the pain, is in the most difficult dispositions to heal.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that in which you find the pain, look at the ear of the patient towards the sun.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And so if you see swelling apparent, open it with a subtle spatula of which this is the form:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If its end in which the breadth is small, of which one part is acute and the other not, and let the spatula be of two sides smooth so that it does not hurt the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And if the inflammation is from flesh grown in the ear or in the middle of it, then open it with subtle tweezers and cut that vigourously until all the flesh is expelled.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the inflammation is in the preon of the ear, then take a slender rod and warm it by fire a little, and then insert that into the middle of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And so if you have seen swelling with what the patient feels with ease because of the weight, relieve the pressure on it with ease; and beware that you do not hurt the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then put on the ear a piece of linen according to the size of the opening which you have wrapped in Egyptian ointment; and do this for several days until you are sure of the hardening of the swelling; or take some and moisten it with water and sprinkle that over it, having threshed and used it; and if you see the ear already puffed up, then pull off that linen and replace it with another which you wrap in cerote made from oil of roses, until the swelling is reduced; and then treat it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if bleeding happens, then soak sponge or linen in warm water and place it over the ear, and use the other treatment which constricts the flow of blood, which is said in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Of the treatment of itchiness that comes to the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athezil which comes to the eyelids of eyes some time moist, sometimes dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore take those with tweezers or with a spatula, and split them with the tip of your knife, and then place it over the spots having threshed it.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if pain with flow of blood comes, then cauterize those with a small, subtle cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is when the splits and wounds return no more after some cause has been removed from their tips; and when they are cauterized by fire, those tips are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment for the swelling that comes to the eyelids of the eyes.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Sometimes there is a swelling in the eyelids of the eyes due to some cause that resembles a growth in strength and hardness, and because of this swelling it is called a growth.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is the accumulation of thick humidity in the eyelid, both above and below.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the treatment for these is that one should consider whether the swelling comes from something external to the eyelid and is swollen throughout; and the cause of this is le پرخورة.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore, open a slit in that place according to its width, and carefully scrape it throughout to allow the humor to escape; then suspend it with thread and tie it off.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you are not prepared for the incision into it except by penetrating the eyelid little by little, then this is not noticed in any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the growth is large, then adjust it with a stitch; and treat that until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, you will not suffer harm from it because the oil of the eye restores and heals it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the swelling is inclining towards the inner parts of the eyelid, then open the eyelid and suspend the growth with thread, another that you prepare for incision, and press it from all sides, and if the eyelid is extended by incision, then this does not matter in any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And you can open with a slit of width and an incision throughout the eyelid, and the hot humor escaping through the nature of the eye; but if the tension is general in the eyelid so that the humor cannot escape through the nature of the eye except by incision, then make the incision, wash the eye with salted water, and treat the place until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Of the treatment of a circle in the eyelid above the eye.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	A circle is a gray thing which is engendered in the tunics of the eyelid above, and mainly in infants, it harms those eyes and adds to their catarrh; and they cannot look at the brightness of the sun because of that which causes them to weep.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And because the hot humor cannot escape through the nature of the eye except by incision and if it causes general tension in the eyelid, open the eyelid with a slit of width and scrape it throughout to allow the hot humor to escape.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And there is another method of treatment for that in which the patient rests his head on you, and then he covers himself with a cloth and makes heat, and makes a circle according to the amount which contains arthernach throughout, and then he puts that on it and presses with his hands so that the catarrh is collected in the middle of the circle, and then open in the middle of that humid place with a spatula by making an incision through the width, and the incision should not be larger than the incision made in phlebótomy.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But in the previous case, split the cord all the way until you reach the catarrh, for in most cases, catarrh is reached through the incision according to the form of whitened gray matter.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore, extract it with pieces of cloth which you have wrapped between your fingers to the outside parts and revolve it between the right and left hand until it is dispersed.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And beware that you do not insert in the incision so that with the spatula, you do not reach the eye and scrape it.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if you do not see catarrh at the beginning of the incision, but you insert a little with ease so that it processes catarrh; and then extract it as we have said before, and then moisten the cloth in water and wine and place them on the place and bind those tightly.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And if someone has torn salt and places it in the cavity of the incision so that what remains of that humidity.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if pus occurs in the place of the vein, then treat that with soft bandages until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of the treatment of a circle in the eyelid below the eye.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When in the eyelids of the eyes, the natural hairs are born under the skin and are old, then those cause illness to the eye and lead to conditions of illness such as constant tears and softening of the eyelids and the membrane beneath them, which is a cause of destruction of the eye called tactinir of the eye, and it is cured in four ways: either by cautery with fire; or with sharp medicine as previously said in the chapter on cautery; or tactinir is caused by incision and suturing; or by cannas as I will say.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And then you will place the head of the patient towards you; lift the eyelid of the eye with your left hand, and if it is lifted, that is good; and if not, insert a needle into that part where there is pus below the eyelid, and push the needle with the pus upwards towards the margin of the eyelid near where the hairs are born, and pull the pus to the top with the eyelid, and release it.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	And then probe inside the eyelid below the hairs with a spatulate instrument into the tear duct where it joins the major lacrimal canal and enters the minor lacrimal canal; then extract the pus and place a small piece of cotton or cloth underneath the eyelid, and sign on the eyelid with a tent, forming a shape like a tail fin.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	However, the shape should be according to the amount of swelling in the eyelid, because this varies among people; some require that a large quantity be cut out from the eyelid according to the amount by which it is softened.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And then probe with the spatulate instrument along the two lines you have marked, beginning at where the major lacrimal canal joins the minor lacrimal canal.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your incision is close to the natural hairs according to the thickness of the membrane, it is good.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And then place the probe in one of the two corners of the pouch, and scrape away the entire lining, and with a thread or fine wool, stitch together the two lips, and clean the blood, and adhere what is superfluous of the membranes above the eyelids by applying some viscous substance, if you wish to do so, and if not, don't cure it.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And then let the stitching of the membranes be for three or four days, and then cure it.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you want, let the poultice be unsutured, and cure it with something that dries and constricts, because the eyelid is raised due to the sealing of the poultice and the addition of heat; but stitching is better. And so I have said about tactinir.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	However, there should be diligence in performing it on the patient, and it is a good operation without fear.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	There is another method for tactinir, which is to mark the shape of a tail fin on the eyelid, and then lift the eyelid with three hooks separated and gathered together according to this shape:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if that is not possible, and the hooks are not available, then take a needle with thread and insert it at the center of the figure, and push the other end near the major lacrimal canal, and the other end near the minor lacrimal canal, and gather between your fingers the membranes with equality, and then with them, lift up your hand with equal elevation, lifting up all of the pouch which has been marked as we have recommended.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then stitch together the two lips of the pouch and cure it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if pus occurs due to your incision or probing, treat that pustule with ceronium and similar substances, and with ointment.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And sometimes it happens that the eyelids turn inwards, so then you should use what we have said about incision; but stitching in each case is more artificial.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Tactinir with cannas is according to this form:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And it is that you convert the eyelid and split the figure inside according to what I have described; and then with skill, make two cannas or two thin rods whose length is according to the length of the eyelid and whose breadth is less than the breadth of the spatulate instrument.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already cut at the ends of some parts where you hold the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then gather each one with subtlety beneath what is superfluous of the eyelid of the eye, and tightly constrict the cannas in some parts with strong compression, and leave it for several days; because the pouch will die and become black and rot away, and when it falls, it will push itself out.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if it is delayed, then break it with tongs, and cure the pouch until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	And so when it is solidified, the eyelid is lifted and the hairs do not prick.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the form of two cannas which you will make according to this form:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and have the quantity of length and breadth neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	Of the elevation of hairs pricking in the eye with a needle when the hair is hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When there are non-natural hairs, hard and rough and pricking the eyes, then the operation on it is that you take a thin needle and place in it thread of fine silk, and then you gather its ends and twist them in a most subtle manner.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And let the length of the hairs be the quantity of a palm.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then you compose another thin thread under it in a short manner, and twist its ends if you wish to do so.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then place the patient's head towards you, and let it be near the sunlight so that your work is seen clearly, because it is a subtle and delicate operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then insert the needle at the root of the hair which needs skill, and make it penetrate the eyelid quickly while extracting that above the natural hair.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull the hair out from under it and insert it into the eye, and let there be one or two or three hairs at most and not more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand out with it so that the hair is extracted with the natural hair.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if it is pulled out with the thread and the hair is not extracted, then pull out the thread from its parts under the hair which you have composed with that thread, so that when it is pulled out from above, the hair will be extracted with it.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And then examine it with the sight of the eye, because when you pull out the thread and the hair, and it does not stick to the membrane, the eye will be clear, and the clause will go away in two or three days, and the hair will adhere to its place and grow well on it.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the hair is longer, then you gather a long hair of the natural hairs, and elevate it with that, or let the one which you have gathered be elevated with it so that it is stretched out and you elevate it.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Of the cure of a hemorrhoid which appears in the eyelid above it.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When there is a hemorrhoid in the eye, and it is a contraction of the eyelid when it is contracted on one side or the other, from bad healing of membrane or from incisions or cauterization, and it is called leporina, and this inflammation or is natural or accidental, and it is caused by healing of membrane or from incisions or cauterization, or from similar things to their sick ones.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The manner of the operation on it is that you split that consolidation and separate its lips, and place in it a piece of linen thread, and gather those so that they are healed.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And it is necessary that you use a dressing for him from the causes which dry out; for if you do this, it will return in a worse condition than it was before.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use in that which causes softening, such as fenugreek, and steep it in the water in which there are alder wood and seeds, or aquilon ointment, which should be liquefied with one of the oils, and soak the limb in it, and cure it with that.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	And the secret to your treatment is that you should not pierce anything which has not consolidated according to its original form.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation which we have described is merely a correction of the ehalixacratis which does not return the shape of the location according to how it was before.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter .14.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the cure of ehacrats which is done on the eyelid:
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This alxacrati which is done on the eyelid, which is aptly named vertadierament alxacrati; and it is of two types, either natural or accidental.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	But if it is accidental, it is not due to the eyelid itself, but because there is some cold and moist humour in the eyelid which cannot drain in any other way than directly, and alxacrati is named for that which is directly vertadieramente. However, if it is accidental, it is caused by a wound or a tear or cautery or something similar.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the method of operation for this is that you take a needle with a double thread, and pierce the flesh, and make the thread pass from the tear duct on the left into the one on the right, so that the thread passes through both ends of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	Then stretch out the flesh at its edges with the needle and sew it up with the needle, and insert the needle with a broad spatula.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And so if it returns the shape of the eyelid as it should be, that is good; and if not, take a needle and place it in the split figure, and with that convert the eyelid, and close both slits on either side of the eyelid.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And the ends of the two slits are two angles of the incision, which you have made so that they meet; and an angle is made from them when they come together, and a figure is made from them.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is a Greek letter: the lambda.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	And then cut the flesh to the amount that is the edge of it below it, so that it does not hinder the eyelid.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then bring the separated parts together and sew them with a thread of wool; and then cure those with what we have said about the softening medicines and the poultices until it is healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if alxacrati occurs due to a wound or a tear or cautery, then you should split with a flat fissure over the hairs of the eyelid as has been described.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	And then separate with the poultice between two lips as we have said.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the sum of the speech on the cure of alxacrati when it is above or below, let there be an operation in it, according to how it is prepared for the form of alxacrati; and that is in the form of different dots.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the wise artisans always prepare in whatever way is possible for them to return the figure to its natural form, or close to it, and that patient according to what suits them from the operation and the instruments in the greatest dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter .15.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Of the adhesion of the eyelid to the conjunctiva or the cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this consolidation occurs to many people who have the eyelid glued more above the white of the eye, and is prohibited from the facility of movement and its natural actions, therefore you should insert the edge of a needle under the eyelid, and raise it up, or stretch it with unguent.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	And then you insert the adhesion with a broad spatula, which does not have any sharpness to the incisions, having dulled a little so that the patient is not disturbed after the operation, and remove the spatula so that it does not hurt the eye with its sharpness.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And your incision should cut through that adhesion with ease so that the eyelid is returned to its natural form, and all the adhesion is healed.
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	And then you put into the eye salted water with which you wash it; or distill in it wine dissolved in water.
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	And then separate between the eyelid and the eye with a poultice of eggs, and apply over the eye wool soaked in white of egg; and on the third day use causes to consolidate it until it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter .16.
