De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	Of incision of nail and prominence of flesh in the tear ducts.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Know that ungla is according to two ways; for it may be nervous, and be like a hard, thin cipha; or it may not be nervous, like white moisture congealed, which when the iron touches it, may be taken with unguent, and it is severed and the unguent is not put in it.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	And both kinds do not heal except from the major tear duct as it gradually covers the sight and prohibits light and movement of the eye.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	But the way to act in the incision of it is that the patient tilts his head down, and then open his eyes, and raise the eyelid with your hand, and then gather the nail with little doublings of unguent and stretch it upwards.
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	And then take a needle and pierce with it the nail of a horse or ox or cow or similar animal, or of strong fiber, or double the end of the needle little by little and insert that into the edge of the nail, and pierce with the needle, and bind with wax the nail; and stretch it upwards, and loosen it on its edges, and cut with the fiber the side of the nail which covers the pupil.
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And so you follow that with the fiber into the depths of it.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	And then you insert the remnants into the roots of the tear duct with a broad spatula or small forceps, and cut the flesh of the natural tear duct so that through incision of it there are not continuous flows of tears.
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And sometimes the nail with its single unguent, as we have said, and then it is severed by a lion’s spatula of which this is the form of it:
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	And beware that with the spatula you do not touch the tunic cornea and that it comes in it a rupture; and that the pupil is perforated.
Aprop la inscizio geta en le huel un pauc de sal trissa o di cief fayt de siniar, e leyssa aquel entro al autre dia; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	And then the incision is made in the eye with a little powdered salt or ash made of cinammon, and let it stay there until the next day; and then cure that with what comes into it until it is healed.
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	And if the nail is not nervous and you cannot insert the needle into it or put unguent in it, then many times this kind of nail is cured with medicines, and is healed thus with eye and covered in its division.
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	And if you want to cut it, then open the eye of the patient and take a broad lion’s spatula with sharp iron according to this form:
am subtilitat.	with subtlety.
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	And if it is hard and tight and the unguent does not come into it, then distill from your eye wine made of cinammon or with strong vinegar, and open the eye on the next day.
E aprop itera sobre aquela la operacio entro que sia remaugut tot aquo que es de lu, sino que·l contrari apostema caut sia en le huel, quar lahoras tu leyssa aquela, e cura al comensament la apostema entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat the operation on that part where everything is from him, unless the opposite pustule is in the hole, because then you would cut that one open and treat the pustule at its beginning so that it heals.
E aprop itera la tua operacio sobre aquela am razo entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat your operation on that part for as long as it takes to heal.
La emenencia de la carn lacrimal, si notz en le huel per gran nocument, sia suspendut am onci; e inscideys aquela de aquela una partida, e no ultimes la inscizio per so que no inscidesqua fluxs de lagremas.	The tear duct, if you see it in the hole because of great harm, should be suspended with a thread; and cut that one part open, and do not finish the incision so that no tears flow out.
E aprop distilla en le lacrimal cief rog e fayt de siniar entro que sia sanat.	Then distill rose water into the tear duct and do this with myrrh until it is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII
De inscizio de alguazardenic e de aquo que es nascut de carn ajustada en le huel.	Of the incision of a hernia and of what is born from tight flesh in the hole.
Alcunas veguadas en les huels de alcus es nascuda carn roga, e es sobre-pausada entro que cobre la pupilla, o apropinqua o estrenh sobre las palpebras e fort leu comprem las palpebras a las partidas deforo e es assemblada a roza de balaustra.	Sometimes in the holes of some people, red flesh is born, and it is above-placed so that it covers the pupil, or it is close to or pressing on the eyelids, and it strongly presses the eyelids against the parts in front, and it is attached like a ball bearing.
Mays la operacio en lu es que·l malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se; e aprop obre les huels de aquel e colligeys tota aquela carn am oncis convenientz ad aquo, e te aquo am una forcep o am cesti; e aprop inscindiys la carn el comensament entro que tot sia finit am le encisori, e guarda te del huel que no ledescas aquel deves la tua operacio.	The operation on him is that the patient places his head in your lap, and then you open those holes and gather up all that flesh with appropriate threads, and take it with a forceps or basket; and then cut the flesh at its beginning so that everything finishes with the scissors, and be careful of the hole that you do not harm it with your operation.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscides aquelas o am espatum le qual nos havem recomtat en la inscizio de la ungla, o am petitas forfexs am las quals es colligit ascebel segon que vindra la forma de lu aprop aquest capitol.	And your incision should be with that which you use to cut those things, or with a spatula which we have mentioned in the incision of the nail, or with small scissors with which the shape of it is gathered according to what is appropriate in this chapter.
Donc cum es complida la tua inscizio e es remauguda tota aquela carn, lahoras omple le huel de sal trissa, o destilla en lu polvera roga e semblantz a lu de las medicinas corrossivas, e pausa sobre le huel deforo coto am album de huou entro que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	So when your incision is complete and all that flesh is cut, then fill the hole with ground salt, or distill into it red powder and similar medicines, and place over the hole in front a bandage with egg white so that it is protected from pustules.
E si roman alcuna causa de alguardenici e es senhoragat sanc caut, e temes apostema caut, lahoras leyssa le huel e cura aquela apostema am aquo que ceda aquela apostema, e aprop itera sobre aquel am operacio entro que sia sanat, e semblantment fay en la carn ajustada la qual accideys en le huel de aquesta especia.	And if for any cause hernia is caused and there is pus, and you fear pustules, then cut open the hole and treat that pustule with what causes that pustule to yield, and then repeat your operation on it until it is healed, and similarly do on the tight flesh which occurs in this kind of hole.
Mays empero tu cove que alienes tota curacio del huel freul per via natural o per via accidental, obran am ferr, e no metas la tua ma en alcuna de aquestas operacios entro que veges que aquel membre sia suffertant aquela operacio.	But indeed you should guard against all treatment of the hole by natural or accidental way, doing it with iron, and not put your hand in any of these operations unless you see that that member is suffering that operation.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII
De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	Of the gathering of pus in the hole.
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias.	Pus are red veins which are hardened on the hole and forbid its treatment, and they open the hole over a period of days.
Donc necessari es al comensament que tu consideres si le huel en le qual es sabel es fort e en lu no es autra malautia que sabel, lahoras tu colligeys aquel sabel.	So it is necessary at the beginning that you consider if the hole in which there is pus is strong and in it there is not another illness other than pus, then you gather that pus.
E es que tu comandes al malaute que pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop suspen aquelas venas am un onci o am dos segon la tua prudencia; e sia aquel onci de subtil duplicacio segon aquesta forma:	And it is that you command the patient to place his head in your lap, and then suspend those veins with a thread or two according to your discretion; and let that thread be of subtle double thickness according to this form:
o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	or two threads graded into one body according to this form:
E aprop sian colligidas aquelas venas am forses subtils, am subtilitat, e abstergeys le sanc hora aprop hora, entro que vegas aquelas venas esser remaugudas del huel e sian revolgudas.	And then let those veins be tied with strong subtle threads, and press the blood now and then, until you see those veins being sucked back into the hole and being rolled up.
E guarda te que tu no ledes le huel am las extremitatz del spatum; e si’ la tua operacio en le miegjorn denant le solelh, e sias mot ferm en la tua operacio que no inscidas sino aquelas venas.	And be careful not to harm the hole with the end of the spatula; and if your operation is in the middle of the forehead, and let it be steady in your operation so that you do not cut except those veins.
E quan tu auras complitz, lahoras tu distilla en le huel cief vert o rog per que am sa acuitat corrodesca aquo que es remaugut del sabel.	And when you have finished, then distill into the hole head green wine or red so that with its keenness it corrodes what is sucked back from the pus.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible colligeys tot en aquela hora, e lahoras tu emplastra tot am aquo que cede la dolor de lu, e leyssa lu per alcus dias entro que sia sedada la dolor de lu e que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	But if it is not possible for you to gather all of that in one hour, then let him take something for the pain of it, and let him be for several days until the pain of him is calmed and he is protected from pustules.
E aprop itera sobre lu segon que la mateyssa manieyra entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat on him according to what was mentioned before so that he is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de las forfexs:	And this is the form of the scissors:
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX
De reduccio de arizati al nas.	Of the reduction of hernia in the nose.
Quan tu curas arisati am cauteri o am medicina aguda comburent segon que es precedida la narracio de lu e no es sanat, lahoras no es engen en lu sino que fendas sobre le apostema deves la maturitat de lu, e que extraguas tota la humiditat la qual es en lu e·l poyre entro que sia descubert le os.	When you cure hernia with cautery or with a sharp instrument when it is preceded by narration of it and is not healed, then do not put anything in it except that you cut on the pustule because of its maturity, and let you draw out all the humidity which is in it and the pus until the bone is uncovered.
E donc cum es descubert le os e vezes en lu corrupcio o negror, lahoras tu ratz lu am un sturment del qual aquesta es la forma:	So when the bone is uncovered and you see in it corruption or blackness, then scrape it with an instrument of which this is the form:
E es nompnat de aspre cap, e sia feyt de fer indi, e sia le cap redon ayssi cum asir le qual sia fayt punctat per punctacio de lima o aliskalfati per punctacio subtil (ayssi cum es en la forma seguent).	And it is made of hard iron, and let the tip be rounded in this way so that it is made pointed by filing or with an awl (in this way as it is in the following figure).
E pausa aquel sobre le loc corrumput del os, e aprop revolveys aquel entre les tieus ditz, e prem la tua ma petit a petit entro que sapias que aquela corropcio es rasa.	And place that on the decayed part of the bone, and then roll it between your fingers, and press your hand little by little until you know that the corruption is scraped.
E aquo sia fayt alcunas veguadas, e aprop restaura le loc am causas exsiccativas e stipticas.	And let that be done several times, and then restore the place with astringent and styptic causes.
Donc si·l loc es consolidat e es en lu nascuda bona carn e es abscindit le cors de la sania e roman per xl dias, e no es renovat e no es apostemat e no accideys en lu accident, lahoras tu sapias que es sanat.	So if the place is consolidated and good flesh has grown on it and the body has recovered from the sickness for more than 40 days, and it is not renewed or pustules arise in it or accidents happen to it, then you know that it is healed.
E sino, lahoras no es en lu engen sino reduzir la fissura a la forma del nas, e segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu descuebras de segon os am ferr o am medicina acuta, e cum sira descubert le os, lahoras tu pren tribo segon aquesta forma:	But if not, then do not put anything in it except to reduce the fracture to the form of the nose, and according to this way: let you uncover it according to bone with iron or with a sharp instrument, and when the bone is uncovered, then take gangrene according to this form:
Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	Let its end be triangular with iron, and its base be pressed inwards towards the end so that it is extended outwards as it is shown there.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le os, e sia aquel prop del lacrimal; e alongua la tua ma un pauc del huel, e aprop revol la tua ma am le tribo entro que penetre tot le os, e aquel sente le malaute per asso que atroba vent yssir per so quan te la sua ma.	And then place that on the bone, and let it be near the tear duct; and lengthen your hand a little from the hole, and then roll your hand with the tribe so that it penetrates all the bone, and let him feel the patient for heat that comes out of his hand.
Donc lahoras restaura le loc am medicinas stipticas exsiccantz ayssi cum t’e eyssenhat.	So then restore the place with astringent and styptic medicines as well as you have heated them.
Donc cum nays la carn e·l loc es endurazit, lahoras la materia la qual effundia a las partidas deforo retorna al nas, donc aquo es pus leugier sobre le malaute.	So when the flesh and the place are hardened, then the matter which flowed to the parts in front returns to the nose, therefore that is pus over the patient.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	Of the reduction of a protruding hole.
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils.	When the hole protrudes with its totality and does not occur in the swelling nor decrease, then you should loosen the patient, and then let him hold his breath, and then press on the cervix with a scarification and suck strongly with good suction; and then place liniment which is made of alum and aloe and myrrh, and then cover the plaster on the hole with strong poultices.
E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	And the way of the poultices is that you take sheets of linen cloth, and let each sheet be doubled into four folds; and make those sheets.
E aprop pausa aquels la un sobre le autre segon la quantitat de la qual ha le huel necessitat.	And then place those one over the other according to the quantity of which he has need of it.
E aprop strenh sobre aquels am drap dur am fort strictura; e itera las ventosas am succio ses scarificacio; e aprop osta las ventosas e leyssa le huel streyt le dia e la nueyt.	And then press on those with a firm bandage with strong tightness; and repeat the cups with suction after scarification; and let him keep the cups and examine the hole day and night.
Mays si entretant le liguament es mollificat, lahoras cove que sia mot streyt.	But if meanwhile the ligament is softened, then let it be made tight.
E aprop osta le liament aprop le dia e la nueyt ayssi cum havem dit.	And you should stop the bleeding near the wound during both day and night as we have said.
E si vezes le huel ja esser redusit, bo es, e sino, lahoras itera le emplastre am les polvils e la strictura e las ventosas entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that the blood has already been reduced, that is good; but if not, then repeat the poultice with powders and the bandage and leeches until it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De la inscizio de la eminencia de la tunica uvea.	Of the beginning of the swelling in the tunica intima.
Quan endeve disrupcio en la tunica uvea, e aprop es eminent e procezeys fora las palpebras ayssi cum un gra de rasim, e es orrazada la forma de home per aquo, e vols aquo inscidir, lahoras la operacio en lu es ayssi cum havem recomtat, que tu entrometas la agula en la razitz de la uvea de la partida dejos en la partida desus, e aprop met la agula autra en la qual sia fil doble de la part del lacrimal, e fay aquela penetrar e leyssa la primieyra agula segon la sua disposicio; e aprop inscideys le loc del fiel doble e leva am aquel la partida de la uvea en le circuit de la agula, e strenh aquela mot.	When there is a rupture in the tunica intima and it protrudes outside the eyelids like the tip of a pea, and it assumes a round shape due to this, and you want to operate on it, then the operation should be performed as follows: You should insert a needle at the base of the intima where the rupture is located, below in the upper part; then you should insert another needle with a double thread in the lacrimal gland, and allow that to penetrate while keeping the first needle in place according to its position. Then you should pierce the area of the double fold and lift it up using the needle, and tighten that thread.
E aprop extratz la agula e pausa sobre le huel lana infusa en album de huou e leyssa entro que cayha le fil am la uva.	Then pull out the needle and place over the wound wool infused with egg white, and allow it to fall due to the thread being attached to the intima.
E aprop cura le huel am aquo que conforte aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And you should care for the wound in this way until the ulcer is healed.
E alcunas veguadas aduna de tota partida am cercle de drap entro le huel ajuste eminencia gran, e aprop sia perforat am le spatum subtil que vengua al preon del huel, e corra la humiditat albuginea, e descen le huel e intra tantost.	And sometimes, a great swelling can form throughout the entire eyelid, and it should be punctured with a thin spatula that reaches the subcutaneous part of the wound, and the white moisture should run out, and the swelling should descend and go inside immediately.
E aprop strenh entro que sia sanat.	And you should tighten it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De curacio de alconati.	Of the cure of hawks.
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This disease that is called alconatis is nothing but an inflammation that is located in the eye, resembling water that is flowing down and not being absorbed.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	The way to treat it is to make the patient sit upright and straight, then take his head in your hands from both sides, and move it so that you can see the inflammation flowing down to the lower parts, then dry it up and prevent it from descending, and damage the light, and the patient should see the cause just as he did before.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not flow down, you should know that it is water.
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	But if the inflammation is not prepared to flow down by what we have said, then make the patient sit between your hands, and take a thin spatula and place it on the skin covering the tiny space between the conjunctiva and the cornea in the limbus (in that area where the white of the eye joins the transparent part), so that the inflammation can be pushed out.
Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	Once it is pushed out, then you should distill water into the eye that has honey mixed in it, or water in which you have boiled fenugreek and honey.
E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And you should cure it with the other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 23.
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	Of the cure for water flowing down from the eye.
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already said about the types of water in the division and which one is suitable to be punctured with a needle according to the condition, then you should do that according to the health status.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Then you should make the patient sit between your hands on a chair and lift his head, then he should move his eye up and down, then it will be tightened.
E aprop pausa prop de la palpebra del sieu huel la tua ma senestra, si le huel en le qual es l’aygua es le huel senestra; o am la tua ma dreyta, si le huel es le dextre.	Then you should place your left hand near the eyelid of his eye, if the eye with the water is on the left; or your right hand if it is the right eye.
E aprop am la tua ma dextra pren almagda, si le huel es senestre; o am la tua ma senestra, si le huel es de dreyt.	Then you should take alum with your right hand if the eye is on the left; or with your left hand if it is on the right.
E aprop pausa la extremitat de almagda prop de la corona per la grossesa del ray en le album del huel de part del mendre lacrimal, e aprop enpelleys almagda am vertut e revol la tua ma am aquel.	Then you should place the end of the alum near the limbus due to the thickness of the white in the tear film of the lower part of the lacrimal gland, and you should press alum with strength and rotate your hand around it.
E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	Then penetrate into the tear film of the eye and you will feel that alum has already reached the root cause.
E cove que sia la masura del cami de almagda al preon la mesura del spazi le qual es de la pupilla entro a la fi de la negror, e es la corona del huel; quar tu veyras am aquel pupilla am la visio de l’huel per la clartat de la tunica cornea.	And you should measure the path of alum to the root, and the distance of the space that is from the pupil until the end of the blackness, and it is the limbus of the eye; because you will see the pupil with the vision of the eye due to the clarity of the tunica cornea.
E aprop pausa almagda entro al loc en le qual es l’aygua, e aprop tu la atira en jos una veguada aprop autra, e donc si la aygua descen tantost, lahoras vetz le malaute aquo sobre le qual huebre la sua vista tantost, e almagda en le sieu huel.	Then you should place alum in the area where the water is, and you should pull it down once or twice, and therefore if the water flows down immediately, then you should see the patient over whom he will open his eyes immediately, and alum in his eye.
E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	Then you should rest for a moment; therefore if the water has flowed down, then you should place alum again another time before alum is pushed in.
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l’aygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	And therefore when it is dried up and does not flow down, then you should pull alum out with ease, and rotate your hand around it a little by little, and you should dissolve in the water a little of clear salt of gemma and wash the eye inside; then you should place outside the eye a cotton pad or stopa or wool infused in rosewater and egg white and tie it on with that.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	But some of us and those who are from our time place on it a comb soaked in egg white.
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it does not obey you with alum in the instrument of the eye due to its hardness — because it is the case of some men whose eyes are hard —, then you should take the spatula that is named "alberid" of which this is the form:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	And therefore puncture it with that the conjunctiva, and do not finish your hand in the puncturing, and it is not unless you make a path for alum to reach its subtile place.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	Then you should insert alum according as we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	And after you finish your work, the patient's sleeping accommodation should be prepared, in which he sleeps on his back in a dark room, and all movements should be prohibited.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And you should place over him something to cover his nature so that it is cooled down, and do not turn his head to the right or left at all.
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And let the swelling be according to its disposition until the third day.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	And you should loosen it in that dark room and show him the light, and let him see some causes, and you should return the swelling to its condition on the seventh day.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	And do not do that in the hour of the cure or immediately then you should do the infusion.
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	While you are doing this, you should keep it warm so that the water can flow more and stronger through guarding.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if inflammation occurs, then you should loosen the eye before the seventh day, and rectify it with that which softens inflammation.
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	Then you should absolve the eye and place over it an oral poultice by which the eye is ruled from below for several days, existing in the dark room.
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	And you should let it dry little by little and converse about its causes.
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	And know that in alchatea the disciple of vision is not excused from seeing some views, and then you should see ardently about the operation.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And it has been received from some of those who are the Artach , and some say that fire is made in Ayrac magdaam punctured by which water is sucked out.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	But indeed we have not seen it done in our land which was believed to have been done, nor has it been seen in any of the ancients' books; and it is possible that it is new.
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	And these are the forms of the species of magdaan so that it should be over those who ignore them:
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	And they should be made of iron or steel specifically, and the tips of them have this triangular subtlety, the acute tip like that is the shape.
Capitol .xxiv.	Here begins the twenty-fourth chapter.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	Of the cure of flesh stuck in the nose.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When in the nose are grown various flesh tumors of which there is some cause, which is similar to the scorpion sting or to a polyp stone; and this malady is called polypus because it represents that stone in appearance.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And from it is cancerous flesh, scaly, of a dusky colour; and from it is that which is not dusky in colour but leonine flesh.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore, when you are to treat one who has this flesh but not fraudulent or cancerous, let him fast between his fingers and be laid in the sun, and open up his nose and stick your thumb into that flesh.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	Then extract it to the edges outwardly, and then cut off what you have grasped of that flesh with a sharp, pointed instrument, until you know that all the flesh has been removed; for if anything is left in there from which removal is possible, then you should treat it with one of the subtle instruments with ease so that nothing is left.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if it is bleeding or has an acidic pustule, then you should stop that with what the patient holds; or if it is one of the malignant pustules, then you should cut and cauterize that until blood is let out and all the cavities are opened.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	Then let it be treated in the nose near where the incision was made with wine or water or vinegar.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is open and from it flows moisture into the palate, then know that it has healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if the moisture does not penetrate as it should, then you should know that within it is flesh grown in the pustules over bones of the nose to which no removal has come about.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore, then let the patient swallow bile from which there is some thickness, and suck in his mouth seeds of nuts, and place between each nut the quantity of a finger or less, and cause the patient to yawn and insert one end of the bile into the nose with the ray or another cause by which it is possible.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And after this has been done, let him blow his breath into it until it reaches the passages of the nose, and spit out onto his handkerchief, for troops of children do this action in schools, and it is a lighter cause for him who wishes to do so.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	Then place the two ends of the bile, one end that comes out over the nose and the other that goes into the nose, and then administer cutting of flesh with the nuts that are in the bile, and do this until you know that the flesh has been cut by the nuts in the bile.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	Then extract the bile and place in the nose, near where the blood is being let out, a sponge, and do this for three days or more until the gum has corroded all that which is left of the flesh.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And at the end of the treatment, let a lead tube be placed in the nose for several days until it is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if there are other remedies that dry out, use that one.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument to the purging of the nose through which oils and medicines are distilled into the nose:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And make it from silver or iron, which is similar to a small open lamp, like a small cauldron, and the mead similarly.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you wish, make a closed tube like a cane, and the canal of the instrument to the purging of the nose be round, uncovered; to which is attached in its back, with which you grasp it, when you heat in it oil or water that you wish from the sucks and the causative remedies.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these are the expensive purges: take of beaver castoreum, white beryl, ginger, long pepper, spikenard, and saffron; of black pepper one-third of an ounce, of nard one-third of an ounce, and of myrrh one-third of an ounce. Take the oils with a little water of bloodroot and holly, and let the pills be made, and one pill should be dampened with vinegar water and be placed in the nose of the patient sitting upright.
Capitol .xxv.	Here begins the twenty-fifth chapter.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of warts on the ends of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Warts are often found on the ends of the nose, and it grows large and swells in several days unless proper care is taken of it.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And for this reason you should dig into the beginning of its appearance, and cut off all of that.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	Then place on top of it or cauterize or burn with a medicine that is burning in that location.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if its growth is delayed so that it becomes large, then consider if it has become hard, of dusky colour and of little feeling, then do not touch it with iron which is an evil apoplexy; for many times when you cut into this apoplexy, it causes great harm to the one who has it.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the apoplexy is of leonine touch and not of dusky colour, and its incision is possible in all of that, then evacuate the patient and cut into it without fear, and treat the location with what flows out and constrict it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Here begins the twenty-sixth chapter.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of sewing up of the nose and of the lips and of the ear when the continuity is dissolved by pus or similar.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when dissolution of continuity happens in one of these cartilages, few give way to that operation except for some men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when because of some cause to these, you should consider if it is fresh pus with blood, then you should bring together the two lips of the pus with sewing, and then treat that until it is healed.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of dissolution of continuity are already separated, and each one is healed, then you should cut off each part of the visible vein until blood flows out.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then bring together the two lips with sewing and strengthen those, and over that powder blood of dragon’s blood and pound it, and place over the powder a poultice of diaphoretic plaster, or of one of the other plasters that are consolidative, and let it lie for two days or three, and then remove it and change the plaster and let it lie until the veins are cut off, and then treat with ointment until it is healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the manner of sewing is that you add the dissolution of continuity or with nails as we have recorded in sewing up of the belly, or add the dissolution of continuity with bile as we will tell later.
Capitol .xxvii.	Here begins the twenty-seventh chapter.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of extraction of those causes that come in both lips in the openings between teeth.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Many times in some men are found in the openings between teeth of their lips some hard pustules that resemble warts, and some are small and some are large.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore you should open up the lips and split each one of those hard spots all around, and then fill up that space with sagion pounded until the blood is constricted, and then wash it with wine water and treat the location with what is constricted until it is healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Here begins the twenty-eighth chapter.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of cutting of flesh joined to the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Many times grow on the gum flesh that is joined which the ancients called albus, so then you should suspend it with wax or what you have that one with tongs and cut off that with your knife until its root, and let the pus flow out or the blood.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	Then spread on the wound a mixture of powdered styptic or astringent herbs, or both.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if the tissue comes back, cut it again and cauterize it; for then the cautery will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Of toothache.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When in the surface of the teeth of the gums there are sharp, rough spots and holes, and between the gums there is corruption and the teeth become loose.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	So you should open the patient's mouth and place his head in your lap, and hold his teeth so that they do not move, and examine the teeth where there are holes, and remove the cause of them; and this will cure the blackness and citrinity and other things which remain inside.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	If this has happened in the beginning of the disease, then it is good; but if not, you must repeat the treatment on those for a second or third day until it reaches its conclusion as you desire.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	Know that teeth have different needs of many remedies of diverse forms and figures according to how it is prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And the scaler with which teeth are scaled from their roots is different from the scaler with which they are scraped between them according to other forms; and you should prepare these forms of scrapers as soon as you see them:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of tooth extraction.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	You should cure the tooth of its pain with every artifice and delay in any extraction, for there is no cause to suspect that it will grow back when it has been extracted, for it is a sublime substance which causes suspicion in the extraction of it.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But if the patient is forced to have that tooth extracted, you must be certain which is the aching tooth, for often the pain deceives the patient and may be in a healthy tooth, and you extract that and the pain does not cease until the aching and sickly tooth has been extracted, for we have seen this through the operation of the barber.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	So how you should be certain which is the aching tooth and if you know it well, then you must scarify the gum around the tooth with a spatula on which there is some virtue, so that it may be dissolved from the gum entirely, and then pull at it gently with your fingers or with subtle forceps little by little until you loosen it.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then hold him strongly by the jaw with great persuasion or stupor until he cannot move, and place his head between your knees so that you may not harm him, and pull the tooth according to truth without breaking it nor giving the patient more pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And if it is not loose, then take one of those instruments and place it beneath the tooth from all sides with ease and pull at its removal so that it is done in the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is split or worn away, then you must fill that crack with a thread and squeeze it with the tip of your finger so that it does not get caught when you tighten it in your grip.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And you must open widely with scarification around the gum entirely and be careful of your strength so that you do not break it or tear it; then return to the patient for the second pain is greater than the first.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And beware of doing that which ignorant barbers do in their skill and audacity about extraction, without using what we have recommended; for they often bring great sickness on people, which are difficult to be tied up, and the roots of them drawn out entirely, or some of those, or that you extract it with some bone of the jaw so as we have often witnessed.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And then after its extraction, wash the mouth with wine and vinegar or wine and salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if afterwards blood flows from it, as often, then take some alum and sprinkle it over the wound; and if that alum does not stop it, cauterize it.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of the forceps and subtile tongs with which it is gripped at the beginning should be of long length, short handle and thick, so that they do not bend when you must work with them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And let them be of such gross handles so that when you tighten them, they do not bend; let their tips be short.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And let them be made of Indian iron formed from straight pieces; and at the tips of those should be teeth which one intrudes into the other and tighten with a strong grip; and sometimes the tips of those are in the form of a hawk's beak, so that it is hooked, and they are of strong constriction.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	Of tooth extraction and the cutting out of bones from the jaws that are broken.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you must extract a tooth which is broken, then you should put over the wound some cotton for one or two days until it softens; and then insert your fingers or forceps the tips of which are fashioned like a hawk' s beak or hooked, the form of the forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The tips of them are made from inside as with a file or chisel.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if it does not obey your command with these forceps or tongs, then you should cut away around the root and strip off all the flesh and insert the instrument called an awl, which is a little lever, the form of which is this:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And it should have a short thick tip, and not bent so that it does not get caught.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	So if by that the root is loose, it is good; but if not, help yourself with these other instruments of which these are their forms: the form of the first instrument is triangular at its tip in which there is some thickness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The form of the second instrument is that it be triangular and more slender at its tip.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And you are helped with this instrument having two ramps, the form of which is thus:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	And with other instruments used in grinding teeth; for youth is done with this instrument which is fashioned like the testicle of a ram, and this is its form:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	Of the triangular tip bent or short, in which there is some thickness, and not bent so that it does not get caught.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And know that the instruments of teeth are most like other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But the wise and subtle artisans of this art find out for themselves according to what indicates the operation and various sicknesses; for there are sicknesses to which the ancients did not assign nor prepare a proper instrument, due to the forms of their diverse species.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the jaw or other bones are broken, or if it is swollen, then let it be bound up on its place with that which is convenient to it of the instruments and forceps we have spoken of in the extraction of the tooth roots; and help yourself with a bandage the form of which is this:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And let it be bound up little by little with something thick, and let it be bound or held at the mouth so that it may not escape or open until all of its bone is loose; then restore the wound with convenient medicines to that.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is some inflammation in the bone, then scrape it of that inflammation and its blackness, and cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	Of the treatment of teeth protruding over others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth protrude beyond their natural size, particularly in women and especially in the elderly, one must consider: if a tooth stands alone and is not attached to another tooth, and there is no way to apply pressure or a poultice to it, then extract that tooth; but if it is attached to another tooth, then one should cut into it with this instrument, which has a shape like the mouth of a pig and is made of Indian iron with an extremely sharp edge.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And your incision should be the size through which you will cut into it over several days, according to the hardness of the tooth, and so that none of the other teeth are affected.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if a protruding tooth is exposed to air, then file it down with an Indian iron file of this shape:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And it should all be made of Indian iron with an edge that is evenly sharp; and it should have tiny points like the file with which needles are made, with which the tooth is filed a little at a time over several days, so that no other tooth is affected or damaged.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	Then smooth it out at the end and polish it with some razor blades.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if a tooth that is bitten into and pressed down upon by the tongue, then one should smooth out that spot where it is bitten so that the sharpness of that portion is blunted and flattened, so that the tongue is not cut nor speech impaired.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of the restoration of damaged teeth with gold or silver.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When teeth suffer concussion and displacement from a blow or from falling down, and the patient cannot bear to chew on that side, and your treatment with astringent medicines has not worked, then so long as they are not loose there is skill in strengthening them with gold rather than silver; for silver turns green and soon wears away after a few days, but gold never changes color.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And the gold should be of such fineness and thickness according to how much can fit between the teeth; and the technique of the filling is that you take the gold and make twice as much as you need between two healthy teeth, and then let it grow with two curves of gold between two damaged teeth, or if only one or several are damaged, so that it reaches the healthy tooth on the other side.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	Then repeat the process at the beginning of the damaged portion that you started with, and strengthen your hand with ease and skill so that it is not damaged.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And your compression as you tighten the gold should not let go of the roots of the teeth so that it does not slip out.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	Then cut off the excess gold with forceps or tweezers, and press it into each spot with your fingers, and shape and smooth it out between the healthy tooth and the damaged tooth so that it does not cut the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	Then let it harden as tight as a Roman road.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is loose or broken, strengthen it with another filling in the same way at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of teeth and the shape of the filling between two healthy teeth and two damaged ones, as they are bound together thus:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when one or two teeth return to their sockets after falling out and are regrown as we have described, and become loose again:
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And it is not easy except for skilled and wise artisans.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes a cow’s tooth is prepared for some reason, and it is made into the shape of a tooth, and placed in the place where the tooth fell out, and strengthened as we have said, and it remains and serves for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the incision of the membrane that appears on the tongue, and prohibits speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This membrane which sometimes appears underneath the tongue, either naturally or accidentally due to an illness that has already healed.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation on it is that you open the patient’s mouth, lower their jaw; and raise their tongue, and then cut into that nerve membrane according to how far it is relaxed from the incision.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if there is any hardness or swelling in it, and this is caused by the healing of an illness, then you should put some oil on it and cut into it where you first cut into the membrane and where the swelling has dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And be careful that there is no fissure in the flesh of the tongue, and that you cut through the artery and cause bleeding.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	Then wash the cut with vinegar or warm water, and then place the tongue back into its socket; for it is a membrane that the patient’s tongue is kept in on each night so that it does not heal over again.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if bleeding occurs, then put powdered vitriol on it; but if the blood clots, then cauterize the spot with a red-hot cautery that is suitable for such a thing.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	Then heal it according to the other causes by which it was caused.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Of the extraction of a ranula from under the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes an ulcer appears underneath the tongue that is similar to a small nut, which prevents the tongue from performing its natural function; and it is enlarged as it fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation on it is that you open the patient’s mouth, looking at the ulcer in front of their face; and you consider the ulcer:
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it as black or dark colored, hard, to which the patient does not respond with feeling, then do not touch it because it is rotten.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is white and soft, then put oil on it, and cut into it with fine spatulae; and if blood comes out in the hour of your operation, then press it gently with a sponge, as if it were vitriol, so that the bleeding stops.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then return to your work until you have completed it, after which wash it with warm water and vinegar, and heal it according to what caused it so that it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of the extraction of an ulcer from two ears, and of that which is found in the gullet, and of other ulcers.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When pus gathers in the gullet and becomes hard like a gland, the pus of which comes out and is called two ears, when you heal it with what we have said in the previous chapter and it is not healed, then consider whether the ulcer is hard, dark colored, without feeling, then do not touch it with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is red colored and the vein is thick, then do not cauterize it with iron because of the flow of blood; before you let it heal itself, or else it will burst on its own.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is white colored, raw, and the vein is fine, then that is what should be cut into.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation on it is that you consider, before your operation, if the ulcer has rested completely after being cauterized or if it has diminished at all from any diminishment; and then let the patient look towards the sky, and his jaw should be lowered so that his chin is on his chest, and open his mouth with the help of a noble instrument, of which this is the shape:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or of steel, and it should be fine like a needle.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Therefore, when you press it with your finger and the pustule is shown to you, cut it with your knife, then grab it with tweezers and place it in the poultice, and pull it out to the outside as much as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another thing is that you remove some cause from the tissues, and then cut it with an instrument of which this is the shape:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and is like a pair of forceps, except that its ends are curved so that the hole in each of them faces in the opposite direction, and they are very sharp; it should be made out of iron and plated with tin.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this instrument is not available to you, then cut it with a spatula whose shape is as follows: and it should be sharp on one side and blunt on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And after you have cut one wound, cut the other according to this method of cutting, and then wash the patient with water rubbed with salt.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if blood flows from it, treat it with water in which the bark of a pomegranate or bay leaf has been boiled; and also use remedies that constrict the flow of blood, until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes pus will appear in the armpit, and you should cut it according to what has already been said about cutting two wounds at the same time.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I once treated a woman who had an abscess that had formed in her armpit; it was a dark color and didn't hurt much, and it had closed off her armpit; the woman could barely breathe, she had to be fed and given water to drink, and she would have died if this had gone on for one or two more days.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess was so large that it had pushed out for almost two months through two openings.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	So I cut it open and placed one of their tweezers in it, and pulled out a great deal from her; then I cut it where I understood the other opening to be, and also closed off its mouth, pressed her tongue, and placed the tweezers inside the abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And I cut out a large portion of it, and only a little blood flowed from it.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Then the armpit of that woman was completely closed off, and she began drinking water right away and also eating food; so I did not stop cutting that abscess many times over a long period, and it kept forming in the same place as before.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Then I gauged and cauterized her armpit, then bound it with an additional bandage; and I walked around and did not know what God had done to her.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	On cutting of a hovel when it is pustular.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When pus drains from the nose and it is pustular and long, then it is called a perpendicular; and if it is thick and round at its lower end, then it is called a bulla.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But if it is cured by what has already been said in the division and does not agree with your treatment, and it sometimes happens that pus is drawn out from it and it is thin; and if it is round at its end and blood-red or black in color and not painful to the patient, then beware of cutting it, for there is danger in cutting it.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see it according to the way that I have said about its whiteness and length, then press the patient's tongue with an instrument whose shape you know; and then place one of the tweezers in the pustule, pull it down and cut it with either of the two instruments with which I instructed you to cut two wounds.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And beware of cutting it except where it is right on the natural line; for if you cut beyond that, you will harm its parts.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And when cutting, use what I recommended in the cutting of two wounds, and treat it so that it is healed.
