Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is frightened by cutting it, then use fire in cauterizing it without fear, and the way of cauterizing it is not except with sharp water; and it is that you place the head of the patient on your lap, press his tongue with the instrument I have said, and grab the water which I mentioned in the chapter on cauterization, and apply the cause while alive, and pause neither thick nor thin, and fill the cavity of the instrument whose shape I have described.
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the end of it be hollowed out in which the medicine is placed just like the cavity of a spoon, and place the instrument with the medicine over the nostril; and let the patient lean on his side so that saliva or spittle from his mouth does not fall into the nostril due to the medicine, so that no cause falls onto his armpit.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And with your hand hold the medicine and squeeze it over the uvula through a space of about half an hour until you see that it is blackened and subdued by the medicine's biting.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take a cotton swab and wrap it around the end of the nostril, and dip the swab in the medicine and insert the nostril with the swab in a tube so that the swab adheres to the tube; and do this as many times until you achieve what you want from cauterizing the grape, and then let it be dried out and fall off after about three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that the medicine needs to be repeated, then repeat it; and after cauterizing, clean around the grape with a swab dipped in wine, and cleanse it inside with what is in the circuit of the nostril from the medicine, and wash it with water rubbed with salt, and treat it outside with ointment, and inside with remedies until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this kind of treatment is safer than cutting and longer-lasting in terms of fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the ulcer is cured by what is thinner than cauterizing and cutting, for it is cured by sub-fuming in this way: take chalk, hyssop, orris root, ruda, Arabic scinched, camomile, and brew them together with the others according to their kind, and add all of these causes into a wave, and boil it; and let the wave be laded with decent wax, and let there be a tube in the middle of the wave on which is placed an instrument made of silver or iron.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And let its end be inserted into the mouth of the patient so that the vapor reaches the uvula over the nostril, until the uvula is greatly obscured.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And repeat this over it several times until it is dried out; and beware of doing this while the food for the apostema comes out, for it will be too tight in the apostema, and you should not do that unless the apostema is cauterized.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if this instrument is not available to you, then take a reed and attach a hole of horn to its end so that the mouth of the patient is bent; for the horn's hole prevents the vapor from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On drawing out thorns and what adheres in the armpit, and of other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Sometimes thorns or the spine of a fish or another cause adheres in the armpit.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then, if you wish to extract what is apparent from those parts, upon which the eye falls, press the tongue with an instrument before the sun, so that it may be revealed to you what is in the throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And that which is hidden and occult in the gullet, let it be caused to vomit before food has been digested in the stomach; for very soon the cause attached to the throat will be forgotten by vomiting. Or let the patient eat a piece of turnip or lettuce, or a mouthful of dry bread; or take a piece of dried sea-sponge and moisten it with bile, and then swallow it down, for when it reaches the place where the pain is located, it will be forgotten.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And if you take an eel and moisten it with bile and let it be within the mouth and then gently extracted; or take a leek and gently insert it and gently pull it out again.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if they are not forgotten by these causes which we have mentioned, then use an instrument of lead in this shape:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And let it be thicker than a small one, and at its end have a cavity which you may introduce into his throat with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And let him keep his head elevated, and guard against touching the bone of his throat, lest he cause pain to himself or to the doctor with his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But it is better that the doctor himself inserts it because of his knowledge of the location of the attached cause and presses it downward and pulls his hand upward with the instrument, all according to the amount that is prepared within him until it is forgotten.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XXXIX.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of pains that are made in the members of the body. Of bleeding attached to the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When bloodletting is performed with what we have said in the division of the cure with medicines and not with cauteries, consider then in the throat of the patient toward the sun, since you have pressed his tongue with an instrument as we have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore, if you wish to see the bloodletting, draw it out with a needle that is very small or with a fine and decently sharp one.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible for you to draw it out with that, then take a concave cannula and insert it into the throat of the patient, and then pause in the concavity of the cannula a hot iron, and do this as many times (until the bloodletting has stopped and the pain leaves the throat) and abstain from water all day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a pitcher full of water and pour it over his mouth with that, and wash his throat with it; and do not swallow any of the water but spit it out into the pitcher again with your hand, for as soon as the bloodletting feels the water it will come out.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not forgotten by what we have recommended, then smoke the patient with camphor or asafetida through the instrument which we have recommended in the smoking of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, namely when it falls.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And there is another manner of operation in the smoking of it; namely that you take a wave in which are burning coals and the wave be covered with a cover on whose middle is a hole, and let the end of the instrument be fitted in the hole, then do the smoking from above. And let the patient close his mouth over the end of the cannula so that the smoking may not escape while you know that the smoking has reached the bloodletting because the bloodletting will soon fall.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not fall, then repeat the smoking several times and let the patient abstain from drinking, and eat salt causes and als, and do not drink water, and then necessarily this regimen will be forgotten.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which bloodletting is drawn from the throat when it is seen; and it is like forceps thus you see except that in it there is some curvature:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed in the throat and its end is like a stork's beak which is gloved, in whose middle is tightened with a limed, so that when it presses any cause, that one does not slip.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	Of pains that are made in the members of the body. In which is contained the sum of speech in perception of apostemas and in section of them.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	The apostemas are of various species, from various manners according to what we remember of them, each in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in penetration and section of them by two manners, one of which is according to the species of apostemas themselves; and the other according to what we perceive from moisture.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second manner is near to the sites in which they occur in the body, for the apostema that occurs on the head is another from the apostema that occurs in the buttock; and the apostema in the fleshy site is another from the apostema that occurs in a joint; and each of them is treated by operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And yet there are some apostemas which must not be penetrated but rather their maturity must be ripened or completed.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And yet other apostemas which must be cut when they are crossed and not ripened according to their completion; or apostemas that are near to the joints, for when apostema comes near a joint its nature is prolonged within while it presses what is in the circuit of it and very soon corrupts the ligaments or nerves of that joint, so that it makes a cause of contraction of that member; or apostema which is near a main member, if you delay the penetration of it until it has ripened unsoundness reaches to the main member; or apostema near the buttock, therefore penetrate it not-matured, and let not the perforation be cruel but rather that one which is near to the buttock so that its pressure does not make the membrane of it protrude and be elongated to the parts within the buttock, and a fistula be made or that one which is made in the end of it if it is not healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	But know the time of the penetration of the apostema and thus when it has ripened.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And know that it has ripened when there is the cessation of pain and fever, and then a decrease in heat and pulse, and the acuity of the head of the apostema, and the other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And because know that penetration occurs in the site lowest of the apostema and pus coming from the cure of the eminence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And penetration always be according to the length of flesh or bone, if the apostemas are in the parts of the feet or hands and in sites of ligaments, of cords of nerves, of arches; and, lastly, in all equal sites in which there is no reflection for in those in which it does reflect use penetration according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the apostema is in a fleshy site then it is better to let the penetration of it be according to what we have said so that its digestion may be confirmed according to completion for if you penetrate it before this, its membrane is prolonged and the tissue of it swells and very soon the lips of it are hardened and its depth.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some apostemas are penetrated according to the breadth of flesh or body according to necessity, or according to that member of which it indiges.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And let you administer small penetration and in great apostemas great penetration or wide or many dry ones according to the difference of the size of the apostemas.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And others are pustules in which the skin is sunken and cut, when it is made like a loaf of bread and is made in a way that it has already been, as well as what happens in the case of swollen lymph nodes and boils.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And some of these are cut in a way that they have three angles; and others are cut in the shape of a myrtle leaf, just like the pustules on the armpits.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And some of them are given a round incision and a moon-shaped one, and they are similar to those.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But if it is not done like this with pustules that are superficial, you should penetrate it with a superficial penetration or just flatten it.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the pustule is large and has already collected pus, you should penetrate it and not be afraid to extract all of the content in that hour; you have extracted some from it, and then on the next day, you fill up the pustule again, and then you extract a larger portion, and then you do this several times according to the degree to which it has been absorbed.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of a cold disposition, or a woman in labor, or a small child, or an old person in decline, because the animal spirit is many times resolved by the release of pus, and soon after dies, so you should open them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	So keep this chapter with great caution, and then make your incision where you open these pustules, and cleanse the wounds and see if the wound of the pustule is small or a flat one; then you administer a few drops of oil or old wine. And if the pustule is large and the incisions are many, then you should apply a cotton pad in each hole so that they can absorb it.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if a part of the skin is cut off or sunken in the circuit, then you should complete it with old oil or a thread made of linen cloth, just like when you treat wounds or roots, without moisture; and then tie it on the third day; and then process it and heal it with something that helps it heal.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if there is a flow of blood in the hour of your operation, then you should apply water and vinegar mixed with linen cloth, and place it on the site of the blood flow several times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the blood flow persists, then you should administer a treatment and healing, and powders which I have recommended in many places in this book.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in the winter, and the location of the pustule is a place of many nerves, then you should mix powders with wine and hot oil, and apply them to those places.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in the summer, and the locations are fleshy, then you should apply powders mixed with water and oil or wine and oil; and let this be applied until the third day, as we have said, and then open the pustule, cleanse it, and administer to its healing something that suits it until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary to know about the cure of pustules universally, but according to the way of distinction, I have already said about every pustule in what manner is the way of its cure by chapters specifically.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	On incisions of pustules that come on the skin of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	Small pustules on the skin of the head are of a kind of nodes that contain membranes which are made from them; and the kinds of them are many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And some of them are pustules, and from those come moisture similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And some of them contain moisture like powder, and they are similar to them; and some of them are scaly and hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the incision of all of them, and in the extraction of them, there is no fear; as you should not be afraid to extract them, it does not cause arthritis.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in the incision of them is that you express those with an instrument the form of which you will see later, whose content I will tell you about now.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	Because if what is contained is moisture, then split it with an incision according to its length by a superficial incision according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And start the incision on line B towards line G. So when the moisture is evacuated, then scrape away that which contains the moisture, and do not leave any cause for it to return, as many times it returns if you leave any cause for it.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then immerse it in Egyptian ointment if you have some, and if not, in water and salt; and fill the wound with that, and leave it until the next day, as it corrodes all that is left of that film.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then apply the Egyptian ointment on it again and again if it has not healed, as many times as you trust that there is no cause for that film to return; then heal the wound with an ointment so that it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the pustule contains a fatty node, then you should incise it according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	By making an incision in the shape of a cross, and cut between two lips of the incision and pierce that completely throughout, and apply your strength in extracting the membrane which contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if arthritis causes you contradiction, then do what I have told you first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly do in the scaly pustule by incision and cure as we have said; and the incision on the scaly pustule is lighter pus, because it has little blood and little moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes some of these pustules are on the head in some people, and there is no moisture in them at all; the cause of this is that I have struck one on the head of an old woman and pricked the pustule like a hard, rough, white pebble, which could not be pierced, and if someone hit it, it would hurt.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other accidental pustules on the head, this is not in this chapter; except for the pustules that come on children's heads and come from the roots of the hair, but the incision of all these should be superficial.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And make the incision on those at the lowest part of them so that it is away from the body of the pus to the lowest parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And then heal those with something that suits its cure.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the incision of scrofulas that come on the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Many times these pustules come on the neck and under the armpits and in the groin; and sometimes they come in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that come on the neck, some of them are engendered between them, and every scrofula of them is within its own membrane, and so in the nodes and pustules on the head, as we have recommended.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the kinds of these scrofulas are many; some of them are scaly, and some contain moisture, and some are malignant and do not obey cure.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	So in that which you see good disposition in the Touchment, of which the color of what is manifested is close to the color of the skin, and is swollen at all parts, and is not attached to the nerves of the neck, or the veins, or arthritis, and is not deep, then you should incise it with a superficial cut from above to below from the line G towards the line B, and pierce that completely, and scrape it away from all parts, and extend between two lips of the incision with a sharp instrument, or with small incisions if you have need of them, as we have said in the pustules on the head, and extract that little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	It is important that the vein or nerve is not cut.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And make sure that the spatula is not sharp so as to not accidentally touch with it or disturb the patient, and cut only what is necessary to cut; for if you were to cut a vein or artery and prevented from your operation, then stop the wound with vitriol trippled or other powders which stop blood flow, and narrow the wound, and leave inside that which rests upon the edge of the ulceration so as to soften the wound and to start becoming suppurated.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is stopped.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation until you have finished it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then examine with your finger the cause of any other small bumps; therefore cut those and clean those.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if there is a large vein in the root of the scrofula then you must not cut that scrofula from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	But instead cover that with a folded piece of cloth and let it fall by itself without harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	Then fill the wound with old cheese which you have already submerged in Egyptian ointment and then cure that.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you cut the whole scrofula then cover the two lips of the wound and stop immediately the pus so that there is not any superfluity left.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is superfluity due to the size of the scrofula, understand cutting its root, and cut it and administer cauterisation and that which was said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And that of the scrofulas which contain moistness, pierce that with a superficial piercing where it appears to you to be the location of its maturity, and pause a piercing so as for the pus to come out from the bottom of the body, thus as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer a piercing with ointment and similar to those for so that it corrode what has been formed from the corrosion.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the wound already cleaned then cure that with generative flesh ointment so it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of section of the pimple of the apoplexy inside the gullet.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients described this section in the pilhot and I have not seen anyone in our land that it has been done.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the speech of those.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men who have squintiness cover that the extraction of the pilhot is avoided as not to be done because all the veins and the greater ones of the patient are here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have apoplexies with scabs on the mouth or gullet or two ears when the disease is not in the head, use of pilhot section to avoid loss which is made by piercing.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Then when we want that, cut the pilhot below three circles of the circles of the pilhot or four with small section due to width in that which is between two circles in quantity, that the section be in the pharynx, not in the cartilage, and this location is convenient for section because it is deprived of flesh and its vessels of blood from it are thin.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is timid then let him extend the gullet with a hook and then split the gullet so as to reach the canal but avoid the blood vessels if for some reason.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then cut the scrotum according as we have described and it is signified over the section of the gullet by the flame which is of that which has come out with that which is of him broken and by the incision of the throat.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And let the wound remain open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Then when the hour is fulfilled in which the piercing is feared add two lips of the gullet of the wound and cut that alone is the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines which make flesh grow so it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And said Albucasis that the sum of the speech which we have described exposition is not but veined that some of these apoplexies have oppressed the gullet of the patient and the patient has come into death and his breath has been cut off and some go to pierce the epiglottis so that the patient breathes on the spot of the wound from any breathing and be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for that command to let the wound remain open until the wickedness of the disease is consumed; and its wickedness lasts for three days; and therefore then I command to close the wound and cure that so it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And that which I have seen by my servants is that a servant pressed her breast and moistened in the gullet of the patient and cut from there a part of the pipe of the lung and he was called to its cure and found the blood coming out of the wound small.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore he was confessed that she had not cut vein nor nerve and the wind coming out of the wound and he cured that so fire is healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And did not consent to the servant if she did not want in the throat and after some days returned to milk of her dispositions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	Now I say that in the section of the pilhot there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of section over apoplexy which occurs in the gullet outward and is called hernia of the gullet.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This apoplexy named hernia of the gullet is great apoplexy according to the colour of the body and occurs in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is according to two manners because it is either natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And the natural one is without chance of cure.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental one is according to two manners of which one is like node of grass and the other manner is like apoplexy which is made by knotting of artery and in that there is fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And do not let it be pressed with iron unless it is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you probe that and investigate that with the hook and if you tie it like a node of grass and it is not suspended by any of the veins then cut that as well as the nodes and extract that so as to contain it from the skin and sac; and unless let it be scratched all its being, and then cure the location with what covers of cure so it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of section of the species of nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	The nodes are moved from species and I have already said all the species of them in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And let me account thus the difference between node and exitus with hook of doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	And I say that with exudus is heat and fever and violent pains so that the ebullition of superfluity is stopped; putrefaction is completed when fever stops, pain and heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But with node there is not heat or fever or pain and it counts that phlegmon which is at the sac proper.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the colour of the body and its beginning is with a cough and it is made thus with phlegm and it contains humidity and the colours of humidity are various according as I described in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore when you come to the cure of node let him express that and investigate that at the beginning with instrument which is called intrames according as its shape comes in the chapter which is proper for that.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And it is manner of inquiry of apoplexies and all nodes and it is that you take this instrument and insert that in the most humid location which you touch on the apoplexy, and you rotate the ends by that little by little until you know that the instrument has penetrated the gullet.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And then finish your hand according to the size of the abscess, and extract the pus and consider what is left in the wound.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if there is a discharge of any color, then you should incise it superficially as I have said for the other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no discharge from the wound, then know that it is fat.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry it with an incision in the shape of a cross according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	So that as it has been taught to you, and suspend that with an incision, and cut the skin of all parts with ease, and keep the hair or sack, if you can, on that and extract that pus with the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is broken in the operation, it is not possible to extract that pus, and many times it is necessary to do so, and then you should extract it little by little so that no cause remains inside of it.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	Because if any cause remains inside of it, a little or a lot, the node will return according to the most.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that a small part remains inside of it, then complete the wound with some corrosive powders and strengthen the wound, and place on top of that where there is an abscess cauterize, and cure that with another cure until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if the node is large, then you should cut the two lips of it and cure that with what it incarnates.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if the pulse is not beating towards it, or not beating at all, then you should cut and fill the place with boiled tallow that has been cooked in a brazen pot for two or three days until the wound scabs over and the ebullition of the blood stops; and then return to incising what has broken of the node.

Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the cure of women's breasts which are like this with women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some are swollen breasts of some men due to the excess of sleep as they begin to sweat, and then the breasts are swollen, and there are similar breasts in women, and Roman apoplexy.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And for those who have this disease, you must cut into the wound with a lunar incision according to this form, from the line of B. to the line of G., and then remove all the roughness, fill the wound with embodied medicine, and sew together the two lips of the wound, and heal what is within until it is healthy.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the breast sags to the sides and is softened by its size in the same way as it does in women, then it should be split into two of its thinnest parts with two incisions that resemble a lunar shape, so that each part contains the other at their ends, and so that the larger line contains the smaller according to this form from line B. to line G. Then remove the cord which is between the two lips of the wound, and remove the fat, and administer what we have said about the suturing and powders, which are necessary in the healing process until it is healthy.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you are unable to complete the incision because of the restlessness of the patient and bleeding, then fill the wound with a bandage soaked in corrosive ointment, and let it stay there until it corrodes the roughness, and then heal what is inside until it is healthy.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	Of the piercing of boils that come from below the tickling.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These boils that come from below the tickling are of the species of scrofula, hard, and they contain a bag which is sac-like.

E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia. And when everything has been evacuated from the boil of the pus, then you fill it with old bandages and let it be for another day.

Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	Of the incision of boils that occur through an artery or a vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is broken and the vein is hardened which is above it, then many veins will break into the boil. And by the signs by which inflammation and boil are known to be caused by an artery or a vein: for when a boil is caused by an artery, it extends long in the body; and when you pierce the boil with your finger, you feel a stridor in it.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And what is caused by a vein is round to the appearance of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And an incision on this boil is error, and especially in one that is below the armpits, and in the armpits, and in the neck, and in many places of the body; and it is very large, so its cure with iron should be avoided, and what is in the extremities, or the head, should be evaded.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But in one that is from them by inflammation of the orifice of the artery, split it into the vein with a long incision; and then open the incision with your nails and the artery, and release it from the membranes until it is uncovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And then place a needle on it and make it penetrate to the other side, and constrict the artery with a double thread in two places, which will cause you pain when pulling on both arteries that are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then punch the place which is between two membranes until all the blood comes out of it, and the boil is dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer a cure in which pus is created until the membranes fall, and then heal it with appropriate ointments until it is healthy.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is a boil from the section of a vein, then you should hold with your hand what is possible of the boil with the vein, and then insert the needle below the place which you have held under your hand, and make it penetrate; and there will be a double thread in which you pull out that from the other side, and then tie the boil with good ligature according to what we have said to you in the ligature of the grape from two parts with two extremities of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you are afraid to pull out the thread, then insert the needle with that needle below all the boil through the incision of the first needle, and constrict your threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the boil in its middle place until when it is dried up what is in it, then you split open the excess of the vein and let go what is tied to it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then place on it powder which you have soaked in wine and oil, and then administer the cure that is made with poultices and ointments until it is healthy.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 50 of the boil which occurs by twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	As it happens in an artery and a vein, and similarly happens to boils in nerves when they occur in them by impact or occurs due to superfluous heat, and similarly.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is made in the places of the helpers or the ankle, or any place where the joints are swollen.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a heavy boil, and it resembles the color of the rest of the body, and in its greatest part there are bumps on it, and when it is constricted with vehemence, the patient feels a stupor in it.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not a boil that extends into the body, and because of it, it is below the vein, and it is swollen in every part and does not go forward or backward.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, those which are in the joints should not be cauterized with iron, for they will cause strong contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But what is in the head or forehead, split open the vein with a needle.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small boil, then pierce it with your nails and cut off that from the roots.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then suspend it with a hook, and cut it out, and then remove it; and sew the wound with sutures, and heal what is inside until it is healthy.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Of the incision of a boil which occurs in the cheek that occurs in the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Some people have many times in their bellies and in other parts of the body those who are called by similarity to mushrooms, whose roots are subtle and the top is large; and already its lips are swollen, and it is small, and it is enlarged.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And you have seen one, and in his belly there were two bumps which were larger than mushroom-like bumps, and there was no difference between them, white, from the subtle root.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And already its lips were swollen and split, and moisture flowed out of it all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, you should cut them off and pierce them with a needle in the feet for 18 inches. and the other one, wine for an inch.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation in their incision is that you consider if the patient is humid, and the color of the boil is white, humid, of subtle roots; then you split it with a needle, and when you open it, cauterize it in the fire, for many times due to the opening of it, pus is expelled; and if it bleeds, cauterize that.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see the patient is fearful and anxious, be careful not to begin with iron; but instead take fresh lead ore, and treat it with that fire, in the manner we have described; and let this be for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	Then tighten the lead wire around the ore, and keep twisting it tightly until it breaks apart and falls to the ground by itself.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the ore is of a coarse nature, there is often some cause for fear and worry, especially when it is located in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But you can perhaps split it in half, and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then care for the wound until it is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	But be careful not to assume that you should split ore that is of a dusky colour, has little feeling, and is rigid; for this type of ore is cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will bring to mind some things now.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the curing of an umbilical hernia.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	An umbilical hernia is caused by several factors: either by fissures of the diaphragm which is located above the belly, or by a tear in the tissue or intestine, as already mentioned in other ruptures; or by blood that flows from a vein or artery, as previously stated; or by constricted bowel movement.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is caused by a tear in the diaphragm and by an injury to the tissue, then the colour of the swelling will be similar to that of the rest of the body; there will be little pain, and it will appear in various places.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is caused by the egress of the intestine, then its location will be as we have described above, with greater or lesser intensity; and when you press it with your fingers, it conceals itself, and then returns; and it is very tender to the touch, and swells greatly with every movement of the body, and also due to warm baths and vigorous activity.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is caused by humidity, then there will be little pain, and it will not conceal itself when pressed with your hand, nor will it constrict or burst.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is caused by blood, then dark-coloured marks will appear on the swelling.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is caused by a hernia of flesh, then there will be a large and hard swelling, as much as the amount of herniated flesh.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is caused by bowel movement, then touching it will hurt.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And in performing the operation, you must first consider whether the umbilical hernia is caused by blood from an artery or a vein, or by bowel movement; for if this is the case, you are to abstain from treating it, as I have instructed you in the chapter where I discussed hernias caused by arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the umbilical hernia is caused by the intestine or tissue, then you must command the patient to lie on his back, and remain stretched out; then you are to feel around the entire circumference of the umbilicus, and command him to raise himself up with his arms resting on your knees, and you are to surround the area around the umbilicus with a palm's breadth all around the location which you have felt with your fingers; then extend the length of the swelling upwards towards the ribcage, and bind it tightly all around with strong thread or with twine, in a decent manner.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then open the middle of the extended swelling, and insert your finger into that opening, and feel for the intestine; and if you have captured it or kept it in place with the thread, then you are to pull gently and push the intestine back inside the belly.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have captured the tissue, then take it in your fingers, and cut away the excess.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to an artery or vein, then surround it greatly and return to your operation; take two needles and thread them with strong thread, and insert two needles into the opening all around the hernia in a cross shape, so that they penetrate; then tighten the hernia at four points around the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, remove the needles and let the flesh return to its natural state and fall back by itself; or insert it when it has shrunk, and then care for it with a poultice so that it heals well.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the umbilical hernia is caused by a hernia of flesh or humidity, then you must hollow out the swelling as we have said, and draw out the blood or humidity which you have captured within it, and then care for it with what we have said so that it heals and solidifies.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53.
De curacio de cranc.	On the cure for hernias.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said, in the division, about the kind of hernia and in what way it is treated with medicines, and that it is better to cure it with iron without ulceration; and we have also discussed hernias generated by mother and child, and the caution to be taken in curing them.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients say that sometimes hernias are found in places where it is possible to eradicate them entirely, such as hernias of the nipples or groin, and especially when they are small at first.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is old and large, you must not expect to cure it completely, for I have never seen such a thing happen, nor have I heard of any other case.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And in performing the operation, when it is located as we have said, you must first make him lie down and release his bowels, and then purge him of black bile several times; then cut short the hernia if there is evident swelling.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And then prepare the patient with a preparation in which he is to lie for the operation, and then pierce the hernia all around with uncut nails, and then press it in from all sides with a good, smooth knife so that no cause of the hernia remains.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood flow, and do not drain it too much, and squeeze out the places, and wipe away the blood all over with your hand or with an instrument which you have to hand; for there are instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if you meet with strong blood flow from an artery or vein, then cauterize it so that the flow of blood ceases, and then care for it with the other cure so that it heals.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter 54.
De curacio de ydropici.	On the cure for hydrocephalus.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recommended in the division about the kinds of hydrocephalus from water, and the signs of each kind, and their cure with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that which is cured with iron is only the kind of althitas alone, and it is not approached by iron to the kind of timpanites or to the kind of hyposarka, for these are deadly.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have treated this kind of hydrocephalus with medicines and your medicine does not bring relief, then consider, for if the patient has already become weak or is suffering from another hydrocephalus, as though it were in the head or chest and is similar to those, then be careful not to treat him with iron, for there is danger in that.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the patient suffering from violent vertigo and he has no other ailment except hydrocephalus, and is not an infant or old man, then the way to cure him is to raise him up with his arms stretched out, and then squeeze his belly with your hand, pushing the water towards the groin, and then take a thorn-tipped stick according to this shape:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	It should be long on both sides, with an acute end like a spatula; but there must be some shortness in it little by little, so that in the operation it does not pass into the intestine, and that you take out that.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And consider if the generation of hydropsy is due to the intestines, then you should extend the incision from the navel downward by about three fingers' width on either side, along the length of his body toward his right side over the pubic bone.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of hydropsy is due to illness of the liver, then your incision should be left of the navel by about three fingers' width.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the generation is due to melting, then your incision should be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And you should not make your incision over the rib on which he wants to lie, so that fluids do not flow into that spot.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And with your instrument, pierce the whole vein, and enter into that incision and elevate your hand with the spatula between the vein and the artery, and you will drain it; if only the amount of a nail or so much.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And with your instrument pierce the artery until the spatula reaches the desired location and is the site of the water.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And extract that and insert an instrument whose shape is as follows:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it is similar to a slender silver tube; it is made of silver or brass or lion skin, and at the lower part of it there is a small hole, and on its sides are three holes: two on one side and one on the other side; and its end is split like a feather, thus:
