Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	But if the arrow is hollow, then you push that with a strong tool entering into it, for the arrow is relieved by it.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is poisoned, then open all the meat in which its venom is, as much as you can do that, and then heal it with whatever is convenient for you.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow falls in the foot, or in the belly, or in the bladder, or in the side, and is near so that you touch it with feeling, and you can act on it, then act on it and beware of cutting of vein or nerve, and extract it, and then close the membrane if it bleeds, and heal it until it is healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Form of forceps with which arrows are pulled out:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	And when you want to shoot an arrow at someone, then push it with some tools that you hold in your hand. Let the ends of them be like the beak of a bird that are made with a saw when they grasp the arrow so that they do not let go.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And they are made in various shapes, large, small and medium-sized, according to the amount of the size of the arrow and its weakness, and of the width of it, and of its constriction.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Form of the bent end with a hollow cavity like a bird's beak so that the instrument of the arrow is relieved in it, and the push of that hollow one:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Form of the bent end of the hollow one:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	so that its instrument is relieved in the hollow arrow and is pushed by that.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	Of phlebitis of the veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so .xxx., de las quals so en le cap .xvi., so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins of phlebitis of which usually run from .xxx. which are in the head .xvi., so are two pulsating veins which are near the ears, they say alhasisain; two herbs that are on both temples appear to be apparent; and two veins that are on two lacrimal of two holes that are called ascentics; and the vein prepared in the middle of the forehead, and the vein that is at the end of the nose; and two guides that are at the neck; and two veins that are on the lip above; and two veins that are on the lip below; and — these are the veins that are called algelic —; and so two veins that are below the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so .v.; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	But the veins that are phlebotomized in the arms are .v. There is one of those that is a cephalic vein, and it receives the wild side; and the people call it "the head vein", and it is deaf, and it is a small vein, and it is composed of a branch of the basilica, and from another branch of the cephalic; and the people call that the "vein of all the body", and the basilica is the vein which is stopped on the domestic side, and is called "citillar", and the vulgar call it "the belly vein"; and the funis of the arm, and it is stopped over the fire, and it is that in which phlebotomy is done, and it is that which appears above the elbow by a manifest appearance; and salvatella, and it is the vein between the said ear and the smaller one, and it has two ramps.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And in the foot and the leg there are three veins; one of those is below the curvature of the jaw of the wild side; and the second is sophena, and its location is below the leg of the domestic side; and the sciatic vein, and its location is below the leg of the wild side; and in the leg are other veins similar to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The cause of the veins that are near the ears is from old catarrhs and migrations and ancient bad ulcers of the head.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the quality of bleeding those is according to what you count for yourself: it is that you wash the head of the patient, and wash the head of the patient in the occipital region in the place of both veins with a broad cloth with good friction; then tighten the patient his neck with a bandage inside which appear the two and their places are near the ears at two points from the head; and feel those with your finger, and if you feel the pulse of them with your finger, here is the sign with a tent.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then you take the cutting scalpel, and it is that which is incident, and then you insert that below the vein into the vein within which the phlebotomy comes to the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And then raise your hand with the vein and the bone to the parts above and insert the vein with an incident incision.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And let the length of the incision be the quantity of two fingers placed or around that; and let the blood flow as much as you want.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then tighten with powder and leave that until it is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And now I have preceded in the beginning of the book the incision of those and their cauterization.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	But from the two veins of the arteries that are in the temples, the cause of phlebotomy is an ancient migration and a bad habit and a constant eye disease and a body of sharp acute superfluities flowing to the eyes.

And then you raise the bone above the vein to the parts above with your finger indicating, and insert phlebotomy below incident, and raise the vein above; and insert that as well as you have done in the two other veins; and let the blood flow according to the quantity of your need.

E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas. Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada. E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	And sometimes it is opened with phlebotomy of the ear, however not so that the phlebotomy is of acute extremity as well as other phlebotomies, but of lateral extremity, and phlebotomize that according to the transverse, because the bone is close and would break it strongly in it the phlebotomy when it is subtle.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara. E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada. Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	But the phlebotomy of the nose vein is applied to acute fever and violent heat, and to illnesses of the face, and emigration and redness that occur in the face, and especially when it is chronic.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	And the nature of his phlebotomy is that the patient tightens his neck and then touches his nose with your left hand, and takes the phlebotomy needle and inserts it into the middle place of the head of the nose according to its direction, because the vein does not appear to you here, and because the blood begins to flow immediately.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	When you have finished with the phlebotomy needle little by little and caused blood to flow according to your need, then ligate it for one night, because that is restored quickly.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	But the use of phlebotomy of the two veins leads to constriction of the throat and the beginning of leprosy and many illnesses, and impulsive and bad corrosive ulcers, just as with herpes.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	And the nature of phlebotomy from those is that the patient tightens both under his neck with a bandage; and the operator stands over the head of the patient, and the patient sits on a stool.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	And then phlebotomize the vein along its length with a small, wide phlebotomy needle little by little; and extract blood according to a moderate quantity or according to what you see is necessary for it; and then do likewise on the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And then loosen the bandage and tighten the two veins with a looser bandage so that the patient is not overwhelmed, and let him go into the mat that the plague is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And the use of phlebotomy from the veins of the arms leads to small abscesses and pustules in the mouth and corruption of the gums and bad ulcers and fissures, and to bad ulcers that are in the nose and around it.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the nature of phlebotomy from those is that you make the patient face away from you and tighten his neck with a bandage, and then turn back the lips of him and observe two veins from which one is from the right side of the lip and the second from the left; and the demonstration of each is by the darkness of each of both, and that more so because in the circuit of those are minute black veins; and then cut into each with a cutting incision.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	But if you doubt it and do not know which is which, then go to the incision of the largest of those, and of the most obvious pus from those.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And do likewise on the two veins that are in the lips above.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	But custom is to cut more into the two veins that are in the lip below.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	But from two veins that are below the tongue, the use is the phlebotomy of the cephalic one to illnesses in the gullet, to the illness of the uvula, and to illnesses of the mouth.

And the nature of phlebotomizing those is that you follow the patient between your fingers in front of the sun, and raise his tongue, and observe below the tongue, from one side of him the vein comes and from the other side the vein comes, and the color of each is declining to blackness.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	And then phlebotomize each one; and be careful not to finish your hand in phlebotomizing those, because below those are arteries.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the veins that are phlebotomized in the head are those in which blood usually flows in all men, and the phlebotomy of them is done according to two methods, either with the mirtilat or olive needle declining in subtlety; or cutting with a scalpel, and it is called if alnessil, and this is its form:
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this alnessil is that it suits to section and of those are special sides and thin according to the width of the veins and according to the tightness of them.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Form of mirtilat phlebotomy:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Let the side of him be thus with sight, and it suits to open the concave veins full proceeding apparent thick ones, and to those that contain thick twisted blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the form of olive phlebotomy:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this phlebotomy is of lesser width and more thin extreme, and suits the phlebotomy of thin veins that contain subtle citrus blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	But the use of phlebotomy from the basilic vein, which is one of three veins: because it extracts blood from illnesses that are below the gullet and the neck, and from what affects the feet and the belly.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it suits the phlebotomizer, when phlebotomizing that one, to guard well it and be above-fearing in it, because below him there is an artery, and if he errs and pierces in the piercing of the phlebotomy, to cut into that artery and happen bleeding of blood, so that one must not phlebotomize it with a piercing needle, but rather cut into it with alnessil.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilic does not appear by apparent manifestation, then one must let it be and move to the other, or seek some branch of it; or phlebotomize in the end place of the arm, because that one is manifest; and cut into it with alnessil just as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	But if you want the phlebotomy of it meteyssa, then one must in front of the tightness of the arm touch the place between which one knows the place of the pulse, and then press on him with a bandage; and then loosen the arm and cut into the vein with a concave incision with alnessil just as we have said; and be careful not to hit the pulse for some space of the place of the artery.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you see, while tightening the bandage, swelling in the place that you have pressed with a bandage, then that swelling is of the artery, and therefore loosen it.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you see the blood flow in the phlebotomy just as the shining of a child, and the blood is subtle red, then know that it is of the blood of the artery; and therefore press and pause your thumb over it for long space; and then push your thumb, and if the blood is cut off, because many times it is cut off, then tighten the arm and let go of him.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And guard the patient of the morning of him, and be above-fearing of him and do not maltreat him for several days until he is healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	But if the blood is not cut off and you see that there is no medicine present to it, then one must cut into the artery if it appears to you; because the end of him is contracted, and the blood is cut off; or take a piece of fistic, and put on it, and take the one hand and tighten it over the place of the vein with tightness going down on the other day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And then if the blood is cut off, well; and otherwise, then heal that one with that from which it comes before the remembrance of the place of the powdered ones cut off flow of blood.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the cutting off of blood from him is difficult in many dispositions by the small place of the plague and the possibility of the tightness of the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	But from the dark vein the phlebotomy is use that extracts blood from the upper part of the head and the lower part of the body; because it is composed of a branch of the basilic and of the cephalic just as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And one must be above-fearing in the phlebotomizing of it because below that is a nerve; and then if you pierce in the piercing of the phlebotomy and hurt the nerve, stupor will come to him, and it is difficult for him to heal, and strong he is not healed from all, and this nerve many times appears to sensation; and if it is hidden in some men and is subtle and is not manifested, then one must pause the phlebotomy with which you phlebotomize with a concave incision, and avoid the nerve with your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	If the vein is between two nerves, then cut the vein in its length.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The use of phlebotomy on the cephalic vein is to reduce the blood in the head and help with illnesses of the brain.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And for this specifically, if you wish to perform phlebotomy, use olive-wood or myrtle phlebotomy; for it is the safest of all veins, since no artery or nerve lies beneath it.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	But however, when you do the phlebotomy, be sure to avoid piercing the head of the lizard, and instead aim for the nearest spot, and do not press on it, unless it is detected by the first percussion that there are some veins there.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	But however, it is very rare for an aposteme to appear in some people when they are not phlebotomized on the first percussion, but do not press on that aposteme.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	But the quality of that phlebotomy and its accidents are many, in which you should consider their correction.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first of these is that one should know that phlebotomy is not administered only for the sake of health and in anticipation of it, and to guard against the onset of illnesses, and that phlebotomy be done on one of the veins that are in the arm: cephalic, fuscus, and basilic; and that phlebotomy be done at the beginning of spring, after breakfast in spring and autumn, and in winter near the meal, when signs of fullness appear.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And phlebotomy be done on the third day or the first day after three hours have passed from the start of the day.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	But phlebotomy that is administered should be done when it is convenient and necessary, at any time of the night or day, at all hours and at all times.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And children should not be phlebotomized until they are 14 years old, and pregnant women should not be phlebotomized except from the fourth month to the seventh, and the elderly should not be phlebotomized after they have passed the age of 60.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And when someone wants to be phlebotomized for any reason, one should cleanse the intestines before phlebotomy with a lion's-wool cleansing, if there is a retained fissure in them, so that the veins do not spit out the superfluities during phlebotomy of the intestines, which are purged, and that they do not harm the principal members.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And those who are phlebotomized should not be suffering from jaundice or diarrhea, nor recovering from any illness or drunkenness, and not suffering from a cold or fever, and not just after taking a bath, and not when colic is being felt, or vomiting, or pain in the belly, or multiplication of cough and fever and exertion from meals, or wakefulness, or from anything that weakens the body or animal.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And consider in subtle bleeding before this if the blood is thick, with food and drink, and with medicines if that is possible for it.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And enter into a bath if any cause does not prohibit it, or exercise in some way so that the blood is thinned out.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And pause the phlebotomy of him at the feet during the third hour of the day, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And you should ensure that the feet of him are guarded during that day from all accidents of animals, as they are anguish, anger, fear, and from all bodily accidents, as they are labor and excessive pain and cough and their likes.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And to his own self, let the causes be present in the use of which, according to custom, people are healed by aromatics and ointments and balms and their likes according to the quantity of possibility.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And the phlebotomist should follow over a cushion that is higher than the cushion of him who is to be phlebotomized.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	And then stretch out his arm, and rub that with his hand the phlebotomist two or three times; and then tighten the bandage with a belt and wrap him up two times.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And the tightness should be moderate, for when the tightness is unequal or the tightness is on superfluousness, then the flow of blood is prohibited; or it is on softening, and then the blood of the body runs out.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And then the tightness, let him who is to be phlebotomized rub his hands together in between them so that the veins are puffed up and declared to the sense.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And then the phlebotomist anoint his phlebotomy with a little of ancient oil properly; and then pause his right hand's thumb over that vein from which he wants to phlebotomize so that the vein runs a little, and the percussion is pressed down because from those veins from which one draws out blood, they are stretched like cords, and from those is full of windiness, and when he pauses the phlebotomy over that it is contracted from the phlebotomy, and is drawn back the phlebotomist; and the phlebotomy does not open the vein, and if it opens it, then that vein is tightened.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And so, therefore let the phlebotomist be firm and be solicited in all these causes.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And then pause the phlebotomies, but if the vein is opened in one go, let it be; and if not, you iterate that again another time over that spot a little bit, or over it with a compression, if the spot is not apostemat.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the spot is apostemat, or the patient feels faint, then you leave it for one day or two, and do not tighten the bandage, for very soon it will draw out an aposteme cauterized, nor enter into a bath.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And then repeat the phlebotomy if she has a fever.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the perception is slight and the blood flows subtly, and you fear that it does not draw out the amount of blood that one wants, then you iterate the phlebotomy in that vein according to rectitude and adjust in the perception a little bit, and do this with a compression before that spot is apostemat, for the spot is apostemat in most men from slight perception.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if he is already apostemat then do not iterate over him, for it does not excuse you any cause; and pause over that spot some part of the fissure of oil, for it arouses the blood of the body.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And is better in this spot than other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	And similarly administer fissure of oil in every phlebotomy from which phlebotomies the veins because the prohibition of blood of the body, and do this tyriaca alfolic and sarsaparilla when it is paused over that spot, for the blood is thinned out and is moved when it is thick.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if in the spot of the phlebotomy a large aposteme is generated from many times, and especially to him who is not stat bleeding except that go, or in the perception of the vein little, then you cover it up, and pause over the spot sponge soaked in water and salt, little warmed, for it is dissolved.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And let him do this then the issue of blood from that vein with complement of him or another vein.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if there appears in the spot for several days any blackness or viridity, do not worry about it; and if you want, pause over that any cause of aloe and of myrrh dissolved, or any cause of juice of mallows or of balm or their likes.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And many times happens apostemes and eminences from phlebotomy of the basilic vein.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	And then place your hand over it, and if you find softness under your compression on it, then that protuberance is evil and bad; and so beware of placing on it any cause of what we have said, for the arterial blood will quickly flow from it.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And make a poultice with what is stiffening it, so that the area is hardened, and then cure it with another cure until it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And draw out blood from the vein according to the amount of its virtue and according to the colour appearing over the blood according to what appears.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	For if the blood is black, then let it issue until it is red; and likewise if you see it thick, then let it issue until it becomes thin; and likewise if it is acute, let its keenness be stopped.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	And for him who is full and strong and has a need of bloodletting in one sitting, let the phlebotomy of the vein be enlarged and the phlebotomies be wide.
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	And for him who is frail, let the contrary of this be done, and let him who draws out the blood do so in several sittings, and let the incision be narrow.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	And the best that is administered in phlebotomy of a vein is that it be a transverse section, not a puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	And this manner of phlebotomy is safe from blood flow and incision of nerves, and it is more praiseworthy and safer than phlebotomy according to width and length.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	And to whom it is accustomed to occur fainting because of phlebotomy, let you cure him before the phlebotomy with a little bread soaked in wine of myrrh or simple oxymel warmed; and draw out some of his blood in three or four sittings.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	And if it is paleness of complexion, then take before the phlebotomy bread soaked in myrrh syrup or in spiced honey syrup with pepper, cinnamon, ginger and similar things, or in scented syrup and very odorous.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	And if fainting occurs because of phlebotomy, and it is caused by much blood loss, then let him take to drink water with meat and scented syrup very subtle; and use aromaticity with hellebore, and let his feet be bound with that.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use the other causes that we have spoken of in the division in the chapter on fainting by evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And who wants to empty his arm and dissolve his blood second time, let him of whom the phlebotomy is for great evacuation, and whose virtue is cold, evacuate the blood little by little according to the amount of his virtue in continuous days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	But who wants to empty his arm and let out his blood second time, and whose body is strong, then do that about seven or nine hours from the first phlebotomy.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	But who wants to draw out blood from his body contrary to the side to which it declines, let him be bled in the second or third day.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	But the body in which much blood has already been drawn and is acute and fever occurs, let him have blood taken from him in one sitting and let a great quantity be taken from him and let the incision be enlarged so that fainting does not occur, for you will have observed all the conditions of phlebotomy; and let you place your hand over his pulse because of the blood of the body, lest he die from fainting, for many times this happens when the phlebotomist is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And do not, when you want to loosen the arm and evacuate blood second time, when the orifice of the vein is already closed and the issuing of blood is difficult, press upon it with vehemence and the extended arm be bent slightly, for that is very bad.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	Let him be bled until it is finished; or remove that with the acuteness of the phlebotomy which coagulates the blood in the orifice of the vein; or place over that tyrian rose, or sage, and compress that with slight compression until the blood has issued forth.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is inflamed, then leave that and do not touch it until the inflammation subsides.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if the need compels you to evacuate blood second time and there is no excuse, then let him be bled on that location or on the other arm in another vein.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	And the vein called “the strings of the arm” is bled in the place of the cubital or basilic vein when they are not found or are hidden, for it is composed of those.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the quality of the phlebotomy is that the patient immerses his hand in warm water so that the vein swells and appears manifestly.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	And then let it be bound over that with a ligature by slight compression; and phlebotomize according to the transverse slightly, not according to width nor length.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And let the incision be enlarged and let your phlebotomy be over that joint by a little.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of blood is prohibited, then you repeat the hand in warm water and let the blood run in the water until you perceive your need.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you are in the days of summer, then you will be excused from repeating the hand in warm water, and let the body of blood be bathed in warm water in winter time.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the phlebotomy of this vein is safer than all other veins, for beneath it there is no pulsating vein nor nerve.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the phlebotomy of the upper part of the right hand is suitable for diseases of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the quality of that phlebotomy is that you compress the hand by ligature or with your hand, for you have immersed it in warm water, so that the vein is inflamed and has become manifest; and phlebotomize that transversely; and if you incise it from everywhere, it will harm nothing.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And observe that you do not pierce your hand with the phlebotomy, for beneath are the nerves of the fingers stripped of flesh.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	And then immerse the hand in warm water and let the blood run in that, for if you do not immerse that in warm water, the blood will coagulate in the orifice of the vein and flow is prohibited.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when the blood is drawn according to the amount of need, then you place over the vein olive oil and salt, so that it is not consolidated hard; and likewise let him who makes the incision in all limbs be strict.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	But the advantage of the phlebotomy of that of the left hand is that it is suitable for diseases of the spleen.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And do likewise in the phlebotomy of that just as you have done in the other.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the advantage of the phlebotomy of that vein is for diseases which are below in the body, just as those of the uterus, and to retention of menstruation, and to diseases of the joints and old ulcers of thighs and legs, and to their like diseases.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the quality of that phlebotomy is that the patient immerses his foot in warm water and rubs over it so that the veins appear; and tie over the joint of the foot with a bandage; and let the location of the vein be marked by the tip of the finger pushing, and from that ramify into the fascia of the foot many branches.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And then phlebotomize the most ample vein or below the leg from where the toe deviates, for it is better and safer.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	If there is bleeding in the face of the foot, then you must be careful of the nerves that are below it on the surface of the foot, and apply your phlebotomy with which you phlebotomize across them, as if you were going to incision.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And let the phlebotomies be stopped.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the flow of blood is prohibited; then you repeat the foot in the cold water and let the blood run into that place where it was evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomist makes a mistake in the first turn, then repeat with the phlebotomy on top of it a little, because the place is salty; and do not be afraid of it being bad for you, but rather guard against the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly, do the sole of the other foot in the same way.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And from the sciatic vein, the place is as we have said, under the talus below the ankle of the wild tree.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the youth of his phlebotomy is in pain of the hip when it is for hot blood.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of his phlebotomy is that the patient enters a bath, and rushes and tightens the scrotum from the side of the broad between above the talon above four fingers in one long slender bandage, because it does not appear except through that.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And therefore when it appears, then you phlebotomize that according to each device that is possible for you and according to the cross, and it is better; or incise that by incision or cut it by section, because the place of it is salty.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is in most men hidden; and if you find that, and it does not appear to the feeling of all, then phlebotomize some ram of it, and it is that which appears on the back of the foot under the little finger and the ring finger.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And guard against the nerves, and let the blood flow as much as you want.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	Then loosen the tightness and place it on the site of the phlebotomy tightly and firmly, because it is more likely to be healed.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of ventilation and the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Ventozes are of horns, or of ram, or of skin.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And ventilation is done according to two methods: one of them is with scarification and extraction of blood, and the other is ventilation without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this ventilation which is without scarification is according to two methods, because either it is with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the vents which are administered with scarification and extraction of blood are xii locations on the body, of which one in which vents are placed is alnocrati, and it is the back part of the head; and the middle place of it from two parts of the neck; and vents of the chin under the jawbone below the mouth; and vents of two spatulas; and vents of alohoster, and it is on the end of the nose; and vents of two little holes, and they are of two arms; and vents of two ankles; and vents of two thighs.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And ventilation does not extract blood except from the small veins scattered in the flesh, and for that it does not have the virtue through them as it is clearly through phlebotomy; nor believe that ventilation be done with fire or without fire in any disease made by fullness within which the whole body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity prompts for ventilation in disease or in continuous, then administer that at any time at the beginning of the month and at its end, and in the middle of it and at any time.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause of this is that there are men in whom blood is multiplied within and they suffer from extraction of it by ventilation and feel heaviness and hardness in their heads; and there are those who feel fullness and heat in their faces and heads, and there are those whose faces are puffy; and there are those whose lips are split; and there are those whose sleep is disturbed, and there are those who see blood during sleep with redness and ancientness and other causes to them as they seem.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when it happens for any of those causes, and especially if it is in the third or middle of the month, then command ventilation be done after they have passed two or three hours of the day.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the youth of ventilation of the nape is that when it confer to heaviness in the head and at what is sunk into the eye sockets; but believe that that is proper evacuation of all the body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this ventoz is in the place of phlebotomy of the cephalic.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not advisable to use that which is of complex friction, or in which there is phlegm, because it gives great harm to him.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for that, do not believe that its use is for the old, and in the heads of which there are cold diseases.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But to him on whom that is continuously done over him is made forgetfulness; and for that, do not command the venturer to pause his hand a little with the ventouse at the ends below, fearing the generation of forgetfulness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But ventilation of the alkehel is in place of phlebotomy of the dark vein and the basilic: and for that it confer to asthma, and to the constriction of a throat and to the splitting of the instrument of a throat, and to coughing, and to fullness.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And let the ventoz be bound a little, because if it is paused below, it generates weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And ventilation of the alhagdahan confers to accidental pains in the head and to ophthalmia, and migraine, and pre-eye pain, and to pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is in place of phlebotomy of the basilic.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And let the commander not press his hand with scarification lest he incise the artery and light flux of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And ventilation below the chin confer to alcola in the mouth, and to corruption of the gum, and to appearance to them of the diseases that are in the mouth, and stand in place of phlebotomy of the aliheric which is on the two lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But ventilation which is done on the two spatulas confers to caphathe, which is done by fullness of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And ventilation of the two holes within the little fingers confers youth of phlebotomy of three veins, that is of the basilic, dark and cephalic, because it draws blood from all those veins more tender than those thick veins within which the attraction comes to the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the venturer that he does not process too much in scarification, because the place is deprived of flesh, and below it are nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is one ventoz that with which he is ventilated over the buttocks and confers to the hemorrhoids of the anus and to the ulcers below.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And let the commander that it is a great ventoz, and that it is of ram, because the place demands a strong section; and strong its own split ventozes are subtle and let it be scarified with scarification.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But vents of the legs are diminished for manifest diminishment, because they draw blood from all the body, and confer to old pains of the hips and of the mother, and of the bladder; and they provoke menstruation, and confer to bothor and ademil; and stand in place of phlebotomy of two sophenes, and alahorcoben, and of two ankles.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	In fact, they weaken the whole body and cause syncope in many people.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And from the hernia the aliment is brought up to the mouth, as well as from the hernias on both sides of the body.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of the hernias is that you must pause at the beginning, and allow them to heal by sucking, not prolonging the position of the hernia, but instead allowing them to heal quickly and remain stable, so that the fluids can come into alignment with each other.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not stop doing this until you see the area turn red and swell, and the blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you must scrape and continue with the sucking process little by little, and pay attention to the condition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For a man whose flesh is very thin in some places, one must scrape only once and not more so that the area does not become ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the scarifier to deepen the scraping and take a few steps back, and moderate the sucking with ease.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is thick, then one must scrape twice; for in the first scraping, the passage to the blood and its moisture is opened up.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second, it allows for a more thorough examination of the removal of the thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very fetid, then one must scrape a third time in order to achieve the desired result.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	Finally, when we wish to extract a little blood, or only a small amount, one scraping is sufficient for us.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we wish to extract a lot of blood, we must scrape with many scrapings; and if we know that the blood is thick, then one must scrape with a deep scraping.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term for a "scraping" indicates the depth of the cut only in how it is made.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the person's skin is thick, hard, and dark in color, then one must unt the hernia spots with something soothing and opening; in the summer time, use oil of aloe or violet oil, or almond oil, or oil from a horse's hoof; and in the winter time, use oil of snow, or oil of lily, or camomile oil, or blood, and similar substances.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the excess is thick and hard, then one must use oil of amarant, or oil of balsamita, or oil of aloe, or oil of anise, and similar substances.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the person' s skin is very thin and loose, then one must avoid oiling it; instead, the hernia spots, near the hernia itself, should be washed with water and vinegar, or hot water of solatrum, or water of a horse's hoof, or water of bathwater, and similar substances.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And if the person' s blood is very moist, then wash the hernia spots with sour wine, or water of myrrh and sumac, and similar substances.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for a person whose excess is thick, wash the hernia spots with old wine, or water of wormwood, which is marjoram, or water from anise tea, or camomile, and similar substances.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And one must guard against taking a bath after the hernia treatment; one should wait until after the person has eaten and then rest for an hour or two afterwards, and then go to sleep.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is it that must be done before a bloodletting?
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	And if one must consider the beginning: then if the person who is to be bloodlet or bled has choler and blood that is hot and inflamed, then one should take cool things, such as milky drinks, and endive with sour wine and leeks, and poplar bud tea, and julep, and similar substances.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And give them food as well, such as poultry, and meat from young birds, and seasoned foods with vinegar, and to him similarly.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for a person whose complexion is hot, one should drink rosewater with honey, or rosewater from poplar buds and sesame seeds, and sumac, and very fragrant wine between spring and autumn; and one should recommend to him that he drink little and eat little, and give him poultry, and cabbage, and peas, and small birds and pigeons.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And so that on the day of the hernia treatment and bloodletting, one should drink more than eat.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And one should give the person a drink of alcohol in certain hours to certain people with thrush, or medication from musk, as it is musked, or alcelita before the hernia treatment or bloodletting, so that the main members are comforted and the blood is subtilized; and do not take that cold.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the hernias that are not scraped should be hernias that are placed on top of the liver, and over the melsa and podagra, and over the umbilical area, in the places of the joints, and the pith of the finger, because these members do not suffer from scraping.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not needed for those except to attract blood from a member, as well as placing a hernia on the breast in a blood flow malady of blood from the nose; and one should use that so that a thick hernia is dissolved by heat within the member, as well as placing it over the belly and umbilical area, because that will strengthen the member and ease the pain caused by the hernia.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is also placed over the knees when they are affected by pain or swelling; because of the strength of its attraction, their hernia will be eased and removed from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly, when it is placed over the liver and spleen, one must have a hernia in those who are enclosed.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these hernias are administered dry with only suction; and some are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some are administered full of lukewarm water in illnesses of the spleen.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is why the hernia should be filled and large, so it is water alone or water in which herbs are steeped to make it convenient.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of hernia administered with fire: the opening should be two digits in width, according to how we have formed it; and the amount of the cup should be a palm in length; and in its width, in the place where it is in the circuit, let it be a palm in width, the hole should be small according to the amount that enters into it, like an aglet.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It is made of ramie, or citre, with thick edges, of lion, and dogwood and terse, so that it does not stick to the member, it should be placed above the member.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And there is a crosswise bar of ramie or iron, where a candle is placed with fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this hernia should be greater than the one we have recommended before, and the small one according to illnesses and the condition of the person who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And hernias for children and exhausted people are different from those for young people and thick-bodied people.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of placing this hernia with fire over the member is that one extends the mace with fire of decently-sized wood in front of a small candle of wax, and place it over the middle of the crosswise bar in the middle place of the hernia, so that the fire be lit around the bottom so that the body of the patient is not burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it is placed over the member of the patient, and the finger is placed over the hole that we have said, in between when one holds the hernia and does not press on the finger and causes the vapor to go over that hole, then the hernia will be dissolved right away.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And then light the candle according to its custom, and repeat that if it is requested of you.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in a ventouse that is administered for the malady of pleurisy, with water, in which there is no transverse vein or pulse, and it is not administered unless it is filled with water, and it is placed on the member only.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the shape of it: And this ventouse, the larger it is, the better, so that it can receive a great quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter 97.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leechdoms are not administered on small members unless ventouses can be placed on them, because of their smallness, as well as on the tongue and gums and similar places; or on a naked limb, as on the finger and nose and similar places.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those leeches that you find in the murky waters of clean rivers.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And they are left in the water for a day and a night, until they become hungry, and no cause remains in their bellies; and the body is evacuated at the beginning by phlebotomy and ventouses; and the member of the patient is rubbed until it turns red; and they are then placed on him.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full, they are removed.
