E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to suck the place with a ventouse, it is better done in this way.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the place with agreeable wine and then with cold water; and it is rubbed and pressed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the body is prolonged in bleeding, and it is sweating, then you dip a cloth into cold water and place it over so that the sweat is absorbed.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is profuse, then powdered vitriol or eggshells and similar things from the group of styptics are sprinkled on it so that the blood is stopped; or cooked fava beans are placed on the spot and left until the favas adhere to the spot, and then the blood is stopped.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And if it is necessary, the iteration of leeches, when they can be changed.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are prohibited from suspension, then the spot is rubbed with fresh blood or a needle is placed in the spots where blood oozes, and they are then placed on it, for those as soon as they feel some blood.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to close up, sprinkle on them a little ground aloe or salt or ash, and then immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the treatment of the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is many times necessary in the art of medicine; and it is the restoration of fracture and accidental dislocation in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh son, know that the foolish doctors and the common people and those who for any length of time did not read the books of the Ancients nor understood a letter of them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this cause it has happened that this manner of the scientists in our land is neglected; and I have not practiced it at any time on account of all; and I have not employed what I learned, except through length of reading the books of the Ancients and study about their understanding, so as to extract the science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And I have added experience and study in the length of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter all that my science and over the length of my experience tells me; since I have abreviated it for you others and freed you from occupation with lengthiness; and I have abreviated it at the end of abridgment; and demonstrated it at the end of demonstration; and formed in it many forms of the instruments which are administered in it, as is done through addition of demonstration, so also have I done in two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collections from being fractured bones, from which their premise is necessary, before we begin the treatment of broken members and diverse if any.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	So let us begin at the beginning of this chapter the summaries of speech; and the chapters to the understanding of which in the beginning are necessary the artificers and at station upon the truth of them; you are and those who are prompt to learn this noble art from you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when accidents happen to anyone fracture or dislocation or twisting or herniation, then you must in the beginning with phlebotomy or poultice on him, or any embrocation, if no counter-indication from any cause; or is it to one who has happened debility of strength, or is it to whom it has happened fainting, or is a time of violent heat, or violent rubbing.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And let him be fed with food of herbs fresh and of birds' flesh and of crabs; and prohibited thick flesh and to fill up on food and on all food that fills the veins with blood, so as to guard against pustule cautery, and if you do not fear effusion of material from the member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to his first regimen with which he was accustomed.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And therefore when the bone begins to be restored, then let the patient be fed with nourishing foods of food thick and heavy in which there is stickiness, as well as foods made from wheat cooked in water, and rice, and peas, and fish, and bellies of cattle, and hogs, and fresh pigs, and wine thick and similar to those; and by this regimen coagulation of fracture is made more quickly and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that fractured bones when they are in the old and in the decrepit, it is not possible that they are continued and are consolidated according to their nature by the drying of their members.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature all the time by the drying of those members, and they are continued and consolidated which they are from them in the end of柔軟, as well as the bones of little children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But nature adjusts and makes a knot on the fractured bone of all parts any cause similar to glue in which there is thickness that adheres and strengthens it all together, so that it comes to an end of strength and of firmness, as well as fire in the beginning, so that no counter-indication from any cause prohibits it from its works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this cause it is necessary that you withhold the patient's food, food in which there is heaviness and stickiness and thickness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Diversity of fracture according to diversity of the member.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the kinds of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the members, for the fracture of the bone of the thigh is diverse from the fracture of the bone of the head; and the fracture of the bone of the foot is diverse from the fracture of the bone of the toe; and similarly all the other members are diverse among them.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I have written about every kind of fracture, explained in its own chapter distinct from another.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Diversity of fracture in itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the kinds of fracture of bone in themselves are diverse; for there is made arcuate fracture others that happen in them stars; and some times there is made fracture according to the length of the bone: and they are fractures of the satagia and asthel and addition which proceed and do not proceed, as well as it happens in the pen when it is prepared for writing, and there is fracture with crack and disruption in the head, and there is fissure fracture small.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And all species have their own pain or torture in their restoration according to what will come to the recollection of them distinctly in their places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	There is a sign for fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by this is a fracture of the bone known: it is its crookedness and appearance to the sense, and feel of it when you press on it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore when there is no crookedness apparent in the place nor anything done because of your touching when you move the bone and the patient feels no great pain then there is not here a fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that there be crookedness or slight fissure, then it does not behoove you to press on it with your hand and with compression altogether; rather pause over it medicines of which come recollection properly to the place; and let it be bound tightly with a subtle ligature.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that the place when it is arched and not split in two or anything else that does not happen in it satiation, as is rememered all separated from its kind, then it behooves you to begin from your hour at rectification of it lest what happens in it be cautery.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if what happens in it is cautery, then let it be that for some days until the cautery ceases; and let the wound heal according to whatever way you can of elevation and painlessness.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that restoration of it and piercing of it is more difficult than of the bone in which occurs satiation.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And let it be bound according to what will come to the recollection of it.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if in the bone there is satiation, then is necessary extension of that broken member from two parts, if it is the hand or the foot; or with your hand if the member is small; or with two strings or one string and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And let your position be such that you pause the member's location according to its natural figure, while the parts are extended from the broken member, then it behoves you to make those accessories return with painlessness and according to whatever way you can in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And guard yourself according to your strength that no pain nor injury happens to the patient through your operation; and see to it according to your power that you apply one bone to its fellow's company according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And it behooves you in that hour profitably to touch with your hand that, and if you see here any diverse cause, rectify it and heal it according to the quantity of your skill.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And shun violent extension and compression, likewise as do foolish doctors who many times cause cautery to happen through their operation, or cause contraction in the member likewise as we have seen this through the operation of their many times.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And let there be connection, equiting and decent operation and binding of that member, and rest and tranquillity; admonish the patient about this and make him avoid that he not hurt himself in the hour of his vigils and sleeping, and watch his revolution and movement, and attend to his excretion, and attend to all his movements with all your skill; and know that the position of the member be a position by which there is security from pain, whose cause is when one feels in the disposition of the position of the member pain or injury; then it behoves you to change that to another disposition by which he does not feel pain; and guard about this that the position of it be direct and equitably, so that no crookedness happen to the member when it is healed.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the binding of the broken member is that which you consider best; for you to know that broken members are diversified in their smallness and in their bigness and in the forms of those.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And of those that are small likewise as the arm and the finger and the elbow and similar to these, then let the wrapping be of very thin cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But those that are big likewise as the thigh or the leg, then let there be wrapping of tough cloth, for the tough binding connects the large member and binds it tightly all around, so that no crookedness enter it.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And let there be commencement, then your evacuation of equiting, pause the binding convenient to that, over the place of that fracture with three or four wrappings according to what the member merits; and strengthen your hand a little with the binding.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And let there be coming to that at the beginning most superior part of the place of the fracture, and strengthen mind that your binding by which you have strengthened the place of the fracture not loosen.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And let there be lengthening by you of the wrapping of the place of the fracture a little, and soften the binding a little at a time, while you take from the place its great part.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And let there be taking another bandage and wrapping that other part over the broken place, and let there be your operation in the binding and in softening of that likewise as we said in the first wrapping above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And let there be pausing between the bandages of stopa or cloth by which the crookedness of the fracture is equitably bound, if in it is crookedness; but if not, then pause in it no cause.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And let there be pausing over it another bandage, and let there be equiting over these bandages decently made stockings at once, if in the place is no inflammation or cautery, then pause over it that which seats the cautery and which causes the inflammation; and let it be that for some days; and then you strengthen over it the stockings.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And let the stockings be of the measure of thin cane rod, and be formed wisely; or they be of wood of pine; or of rams' penis; and let the width of each stocking according to this form and this figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However let the stocking that is paused over that fracture be thicker and tougher a little than the other stockings, and the length of the stocking according to how long it is from the fracture in bigness and smallness; and let there be strengthening over the stockings with another bandage according to your first binding; and let there be tying over it decently with thread according to what we said about binding, and let the binding be according to the place of the fracture less, and how much less is the length from the fracture.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And let the threads be middling in thickness and thinness, and they be of pliant thread; and if the threads are thick, likewise as we have seen by the operation of some foolish pausing their threads of rope threads, and it is great error when the binding is not equitably.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And very thin threads are not convenient, for you will not accomplish by them that which you want through binding, and it behooves that between stocking and stocking there be mind of a finger's breadth.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is pricked by the ends of the stockings then let there be pausing under those of stopa or woolen cloth until it does not cause him injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Some times fracture is with plague, and happens disruption in the sinew, and we come to recollection in that in the head according to singleness.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that not every broken member is bound with stockings on the first day; and the cause of this is because the member, when it is large, it behooves that you pause over it stockings only after a few days or more, according to your security about coming of cautery.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the way of the plasterers by which the Ancients used to heal, they which are paused over fracture and dislocation and wrenching.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of emplastrum as a remedy for fractures, suitable for many complexities and especially for women and children, because it is about what does not come heat or friction: and you take from the dust of the mill, and it is the medulla of the flour that passes through the movement of the mill on the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And cook it as it is, but strain it through a sieve into an egg white, and use the thick or thin consistence as appropriate; then use it as needed.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another manner of healing ointment for broken bones and dislocation and twisting: take from assafetida, from myrrh, from acacia, from enula, and from mace, which is the juice of wild pomegranate, of all an ounce each; of myrrh and aloe, of each a drachm five; of aloes, twenty; all these shall be strained and sifted and mixed with honey water or with egg albumen if the patient's constitution is hot; and then use this ointment, for it is of good composition and restores quickly broken bones, and confers to many men.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another manner of ointment which confers to broken bones and twisting: take mace, and put of white poplar an ounce each; of myrrh and aloe, of each a drachm five; of acacia six drachms; all mixed with honey water or egg albumen, and then make a good ointment.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All are ground in a mortar with a little moisture, and strained, and cooked with water or egg white, and administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method of emplastrum for joints and bones separated from their places, and pain caused in them, and to fissures and fractures: take soft wool and submerge it in sweet wine and cut oil, and place it on the affected area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	Let this emplastrum not be used to restore strength, but to cauterize and expel pain properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of emplastrum that heals broken bones: take leaves from a fig tree and leaves from wild poppies; pound all together and make an emplastrum from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Method of emplastrum administered for the restoration of broken bones and when you want resolution of the remaining of an abscess: take pounded marsh mallow, chamomile, and violet flowers, and flour of bran, all together in one part .I. Let all be ground and cooked in wine, if the affected member is not wounded.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is wounded, then cook it with water of coriander or with water and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of emplastrum which is stronger in resolution than the previous one, when an abscess happens due to the restoration of a member: take pounded marsh mallow and sesame seeds, and ballota, and marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile, all together in one part i unground; let all be ground and cooked with water of celery or with warm water or wine, according to the quality of the affected member and its rest of color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	But ipocras doesn't dry in its own free that it is placed on the broken member due to its restoration but wax made of wax and oil and no other cause; and return that it is between thickness and thinness.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	But it is seen that they are placed on the broken member due to its restoration and the causes in which there is dryness with little heat are also like those causes that we have recounted.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method of emplastrum that provides to injury and pain: take mace, cesium, human hair or bird feather, marsh mallow, and salt, all unground; let all be ground and strained and cooked, and make an emplastrum from it.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	But the amount according to the quality that covers the bandage and then it is loosened, consider if there is no pain nor swelling, nor the bone is broken not moved from its place, then you do not displace for many days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if it happens to the affected area violent pain or swelling or inflammation, then you cut or loosen it at the hour and remove the emplastrum from it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take a band of linen and marine sponge wet with warm water, and soak the affected area in tepid water, and wash it with that until the swelling and pain are reduced; then let it rest for an hour; then place on it soft wool soaked in sweet wine and oil or rose oil, and bind it up for one night within which you are sure of the abscess cauterized, and the inflammation of the member is soothed, and the pain of it.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then repeat that gentle compression and little binding, and not tighten it by your first tightening, and apply that until it is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if the abscess and rogor and pain and inflammation and all the accidents are now reduced to all, and you have stopped using emplastrum and compression, then repeat that as you did at the beginning equally.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if there is not any cause to the member of those that we have mentioned, then do not loosen it but after three days or four or five or seven. And some time all that is left for twenty days according to how you appear by the loosening of the bandage, as we have said, until the fracture heals, and approaches the coagulation of the flesh on it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then tighten the compression but not as in your first compression all together, and adjust in the swelling of the member, according to how it is preceded by its memory.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see the fracture is already dried and wasted but not closed, then know that food is prohibited to reach it; and then soak it with tepid water due to total exhaustion that of the member; and let it be for three days; loosen the compression a little, and by this operation food reaches the member, and it is healed lightly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But that which is done by the false restorators of the member's fracture due to its not being restored at the beginning, according to how it covers and is restored according to tortuosity, is error according to their operation, and great fear, and if they were stretched in their free parts and turned am on them.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them doing that, because it is more reasonable that it does not happen.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter according to: Of fracture when it happens in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The kinds of fractures are many, and their shapes are diverse, and the causes are distinct, for any fracture is not done by the impact of a staff, and the impact stands all the bone within the skull, which is under the skull, as it happens in the foot, and by this that kind of fracture is named ascial; or the staff penetrates a part of the bone, and penetrates the flesh of it and does not go through the interior of it; and this kind of fracture is named absolute elevation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the split of those two fractures or is great or small, and the fracture that is compression or atraction; and cause of it is impact by a stone or falling on stone, and to them similar.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating that it approaches the membrane which is under the bone; or it is in the face of the bone, and the split of these two fractures or is great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And in a fracture it is removed from the bone, in the subtlety of the hair's smallness, and because of this it is named this kind of capillary fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And it is a fracture that is done by either chipping or stone percussion and their likes, causing some lamella of the bone to enter the cavities inside, and it is done in the concave place just as it happens to fingers when they are hit with a rock and there is an entrance made into the cavities within them.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And mostly this happens to the bodies of hollow bones, just like in baby skulls.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And for all these species of fractured sutures, they are separated as if with stars.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And then I will have the memory of all this in my place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And I know all these species of fracture by detection on those, and by inquiry of their feeling and appearance of rotten flesh that is upon them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And capillary fracture is known by that being uncovered on the bone and being cleaned, and being stung over it, for then the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	But in the cure of fracture consider at the beginning the accidents of the patient, and then if you see by the accidents that signify by manifest signification for fear, as with vomiting of cholera, and extension, and loss of understanding, and absence of speech, and syncope, and acute fever, and sweat of those, and redness on them, and similar to them in the major dispositions, it is not healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see accidents not occurring you hope for health then you begin the cure of it.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The reason for which is that if it has come to you the sick person in the beginning as it was sick and that is on the day twelve according to all disposition, then cover that you study in the appearance of the bone against the day fourteen.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the days of summer then cover that you cut the bone against the seventh day having that which is below the bone be rotten by the membrane and that the accidents we have counted happen.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already come to the membrane covering the brain and it is with small pieces and crushed then cover that you insert the crushed and ground piece according to what I will tell you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And it is that you scrape the head of the sick person and uncover upon the bone according to habit and manner to you possible according to the figure of the plague and that it be lighter on the sick person.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if it happens to you that you must make the detection of the bone and bleeding of pus or cauterization then you stop it with what covers, and you moisten the place with bandages infused in wine and rose oil and let the plague rest while the pustule is settled and blood stopped; and then proceed to the incision of the bone and removing it.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And that be according to one of two manners of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And one manner is that you insert the bone with a narrow incision knife and this is its shape: And then administer another incision knife this one a little wider than that; and this is its shape:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then administer even more the incision knife wider than the second.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And have that it be ought to you number of incision knives various, of which some are wider than others; and some of them are shorter than the rest and are in the thickness of their sharpness, and they are of iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them with facility upon the incision knife so that it does not cut into the head and lead that one.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong and hard then cover that you pierce into its circuit before administering the incision knives with awls which are called non-deep awls.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not named thus but because those do not pass the end of the bone but the awl is round or rounded on its edge and below the head of it looks like margin or small circle, which forbids being submerged and passing through the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take of those awls great number of which each one suits the thickness of each bone, within that it be to you present in all skulls the extremity of which is acute, the quantity in length and brevity according to the quantity of thickness of this skull.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three species of awls: The quality of boring into the circuit of the broken bone is that you pause the awl on the bone and rotate it with your fingers within that you know that the bone is already penetrated; and then change the awl to another location, and pause what is between every hole the quantity of thickness of the thread or wrap around that.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then insert with incision knives what is between each crack of the bone and do that more subtle than you can on its end in fineness, as we have said, within that you erradicate the bone or with your hand or with some other cause by any tools which you will have apparatus for, as tongs and forceps subtle.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And have that you keep with all precaution that the incision knife does not touch any nerve of the brain.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And then when you have bored around the bone and separated it from the brain if it is continued with it, and have that extracted, cover that you scrape and gnaw it in its roughness of what is in the bone with another instrument similar to an incision knife but indeed let it be thicker and more subtle than the other incision knives.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if you break any of the small bones and sutures then take that with facility by what is ought to you from the tools, and then cure the plague with poultices and ointments which we have said.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other manner of operation is lighter, distant from fear, which is said Gualia and is broken by great force; and this is its speech: it is necessary to you in the beginning that you begin to uncover the crack of the bone of the place in which there is the fracture most violent and most manifest, within that when you have uncovered that crack and you will have paused below it the extremity of this incision knife lente and gentle of which this is the shape:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And the lenticular crack is lion and does not insert any cause, and the acute crack is of it in two sides forward in length as you see; that the lenticular crack be attached to the brain by the membrane of it cutting into the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And then pierce over the incision of one crack with a small hammer within that you insert all the bone with facility as it is turned and you be sure of the membrane that no accident happens in any manner which you fear in any way, and if the patient was the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he was sleeping.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	And then if it breaks any cause attached to the bone of the membrane in some place of bones, insert that of it with the extremity of the incision knife lenticular and deliver that of it with facility for it is delivered from it its harm and its fear.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate within the membrane and what is broken or remained of the bone is the membrane of it and you break into it and gnaw its roughness and sutures subtle, then cover that you scrape that roughness and erradicate those sutures with razors subtle by which you have prepared the number, of various quantities so that be to you possible administering them in every place most convenient of them and most proper of them according to what you are led in your operation that broken bone and the figure of it.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And whoever you administer to in your care, with which tools you extract the bones at the start of those wounds, and then use that tool on the pus beneath them, and do not stop doing this until you have extracted all the pus and the subtler humors from all these places.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	But in any of the other small broken capillaries and subtle fractures, whoever you are treating should be cured according to what is lost in order to rectify it.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is a cause that has not been revealed above all those who have studied that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And now about what we have written, we will show in great fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the skin is stretched when you remove the bone, then take a piece of cloth according to the quantity of the wound and soak it in rose oil and place it over the hole of the wound; and then take another cloth folded or doubled and soak it in wine and rose oil and place it over the first cloth and do this gently so that you don't harm the nerve; and then administer on that a liniment, and don't tighten it except for the quantity of the wound.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And leave him with this treatment for a day or two until you are sure of cauterization; and then remove it and administer medicines that get rid of superfluous moisture, such as lint and barley flour, and powder of onions and of aristology, and of similar things to these.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is that you make of these medicines a powder that can be sprinkled over the wound as they are dried; and generally, administer to him all medicine of which its property is that it cleanses and doesn't bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And take care according to your virtue that the wound in your curing is clean; and let there be no surdity of ointment or other thing in it; nor let virulence gather in it; for when it is applied on the membrane of the brain, it corrupts it and causes evil in the patient.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it occurs in the membrane of the head when the bone is removed and especially when the cure of it is neglected, and there is blackness on its surface; and therefore if these accidents occur in the patient, know that he has six diseases.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if blackness does not occur except from the medicine that is applied to it and it is in the virtue of that medicine that makes that blackness, then take a portion of honey and of rose oil [portions] iii. and with those lines a cloth, and then place it over the membrane; and then cure that with spices of cure that are suitable until he is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter iii.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Of restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not broken except in two places, some more prominent than others, or one of those bent slightly, because there are two bones in it, for the lower part is cartilaginous and not broken, and nothing happens to it except curvature and tortuosity and sinusitis.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two places is broken, then you should insert your little finger into his nose and grip that fracture inside with your index finger and push it outward with your thumb until the nose returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And let this be done by you easily, and take care that he does not cry out from that operation on the patient.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is on the most prominent part of the nose and the finger cannot reach it, then let it be straightened with the tip of the needle in which there is a small thickness.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is on two places, then you should do that similarly.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And let him be restored on the first day of the fracture if it is possible; and if not, then let him rest for the cauterization of the wound for seven or nine days.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And then insert into the tip of the nose a piece of cloth if there is one fracture, or two splints if there are two fractures, and let the splint have enough thickness to fill up the gap in the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And some of the ancient restorers say that the splints should be wrapped in a cloth, and changed every day, but I have not seen this; others say that the cloth should be wrapped in a ball of honey comb with powder of moly; and then let it stay until the bone is set and the cartilage is hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And in some cases, let the bone of the nose be inserted instead of splints, a feather of the peacock more robust that is wrapped in cloth of lion; and let it stay until the fracture of the nose is more violent and that the patient is not prohibited from breathing.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this cause is not necessary for you; and if you want to do it, then do it, and if you want to make splints, then make them.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another cauterization occurs on the nose, plaster it with ceratum or cotton soaked in wine and rose oil, or with diaquilinum.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if there is no cauterization on the nose, then let you plaster it outward with sesame flour and powder of onions cooked in honey; and then place over it a sponge of lion's wool, and do not press the nose for any reason.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the bones of the nose are broken with a small fracture or are crushed, then split them and remove them with tools that are suitable for those; and then sew up the cut, and cure it with what encapsulates and consolidates, and plaster it in whatever is convenient.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if there is a wound inside the nose, then let you cure that with splints and administer lead tubes until it is completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter iv.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	Of restoration of the jaw when it is broken.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is broken and there is no wound on it, observe then if the fracture is outward only and not broken in two parts and bent inwards, then its understanding is easier.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, then insert your left index finger into the mouth of the patient; and similarly if the fracture is on the left jaw, then insert your right index finger; and push by that the curvature of the fracture inside with ease to the outward parts by your other hand from the outward part of the bone; by this he will be evenly straightened.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the jaw is already separated into two parts, then let you administer extension of both parts according to its rightness until it is possible for it to be even.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there is concussion of teeth to disruption, then tighten those from which you expect that they will break with a thread of gold or silver or silk; and then place over the broken jaw ceratum, and then a doubled cloth, and over the cloth a great plate decently made, or a stone of only length of the jaw; and then tie that above according to how it is equipped to you as the application convenes so that it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command that he have rest and tranquility, and let him drink cooling drinks of lions.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you think that it is altered in some way, then let you bind and loosen it on the third day; and then rectify what is altered of it and plaster it with powder of moly, with honey comb, or with sesame flour, after you have removed the ceratum from it, and place over the plaster lion' s wool.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And then when he is lying still and that plaster is applied to him, and the disposition of the bone is not altered, leave it, so that you do not disturb it until the fracture is healed and strong; for in many ways this fracture is tightened within three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another blister occurs from a cautery, then administer what we have said many times in the treatment of him until he is healed and that blister is resolved.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is complicated by an infection, then you should carefully examine whether the bone is separated or crushed; then you skillfully remove those crushings with that which is convenient in removing them with instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the opening of the wound is narrow, then you widen it by phlebotomy according to the amount of your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	Then when you have removed those crushings and they do not heal, then you clean the opening of the wound if it is large; and if not, place one of those plasters that are convenient for that and let it become embedded until it is healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5:
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Of the restoration of the collarbone when it is dislocated.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Many times the collarbone in front is broken by a blow from a muscle, and that fracture occurs in one of three ways:
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	Because it is either broken, or separated, or separated into two parts without the occurrence of blisters; and its restoration is easier; or it occurs with blisters, and its restoration is difficult; or the fracture is complicated by an infection.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation on it, when the fracture is complicated by an infection, is that you have two ministers, so that one has the support and follows the collarbone that is broken, and the other extends the collar under that part.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	Then fasten the fracture with threads so that it is made in the shape of a cone and not have a small eminence or concavity.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you need more extension, then cover the area under the armpit with a thick pad of cloth or wool, and let its size be according to the amount of your need; and extend and elevate the collarbone and contract the pad with your hand until you fasten the fracture as it should be.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot draw the end of the collarbone to the outward parts because it is reached by the breast, then let the patient be reclined on his chest, and place a cushion over his shoulder, with a half-cushion in size, under the muscle of the collarbone.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the minister presses the muscle of it to the outward parts below so that the collarbone bone is elevated from above, and then you correct the fracture and fasten it with threads.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	But if you feel blisters on the collarbone and they are not resolved, then let them be lanced and those blisters extracted with ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained in the bone, then you devise an incision of it with one of the incisers which you have prepared for that purpose, after you have placed below the collarbone the instrument that serves as the head; and it is an instrument of wood or iron, and this is its form:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is like a chisel of which this is the concavity; and let its breadth be according to what you need of it, according to the size of the bone or its thinness.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	But its length be according to what is possible for you in the operation; and let it have two ends just as before, and one end be broad and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the opening of the wound which you have lanced when you have extracted the blister from the bone is large and it is certain that there will be a blister from cauterization, then you adjust the two lips of the wound with a suture.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the opening is small, or you fear a blister from cauterization, then you fill the wound with cloths and powders according to the amount of the opening of the wound.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if a blister from cauterization occurs, then soak a cloth in warm vinegar and rose oil and place it over that.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	But the constriction of the bone when it is without a wound and without an incision, is that you place a plaster made from flour of wheat with white of egg, and place over it a piece of linen, and then place a cloth under the armpit, if it needs it; and then take an ointment, so called the one which the Saracens have, which is very long, and let its breadth be of one palm or around that; and then put powders doubled over the piece of linen and the plaster; and then take a wooden stake that is thin, and whose breadth is three fingers, and its length similar; and then wrap that in cloth, and wrap that cloth with the stake at the place over the fracture; and then take ointment so as it is poured out, and roll that over his neck and under the armpit of his arm, and reduce that upon all parts, and when you see that the constriction of the fracture with constriction descends, and this is what does not occur to you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And altogether, let the stake not be resolved over the broken bone; and therefore you see the patient every day, that when the ligament becomes soft or you see the stake already resolved, then you correct it and make the fastening strong.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And then place the patient's head upon his arm, and let there be placed under the armpit of him a little cushion; so that with that is elevated the support of it from the side of that, and therefore is elevated the fracture of the collarbone to elevation of the muscle; or let the arm be bound to the neck of him.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not remove the ligament unless blisters occur in the place definitely, or within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And then renew the plaster when you have seen its face to that, and adjust in constriction and restore it and leave it until it is restored and the fracture of the collarbone is coagulated.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is strengthened and comforted according to the moon in 28 days, and in some men it is made within a month of that time.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6:
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the shoulder.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The spatula is broken in the wide place of it and not broken from it except its margins.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And then when it is broken at the place of it — and it is broken in the middle place of it — and is not congealed except by contact, then according to the figure of the fracture you have the preparation of it and reduce that according to the natural figure in every way of engine which is possible for you.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And then place over the place powder of wheat with white of egg and piece of linen; and then place doubled cloth; and then place over it a wooden stake that is thin according to the quantity of the spatula all or perhaps a little.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if under the stake is a concavity in any of the places of the spatula, then you fasten that concavity with piece of linen, and then place the stake according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And then strengthen above it with long ointment with decent constriction and with firmness of the stake so that it is not resolved in its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.
