But the extremity of that which touches the shoulder and is continued with it, is not dislocated in any day; then let it be reduced and closed according as we have said and as it is prepared for you.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And then pause upon it poultice, and powders, and constriction, and command the patient to adhere to tranquility and rest until he is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And with this method of cure is reduced the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26:
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	Of the reduction of the dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, of which one is that it is dislocated at the part of the shoulder joint to the lower part.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated at the part above the muscle, and that is done suddenly; and it is not dislocated at the parts behind by the shoulder; and it is not dislocated at the parts in front by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And most often it is dislocated and drawn out at the parts below by the shoulder joint, and most often in those of which the flesh is thin, it is dislocated easily; but in those of which there are many meats, it is drawn out with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And very often it happens to certain men by impact or blow, and the muscle of him is calloused with callous, and it is injured for that which has already been dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Therefore let you know this while you are standing over him, and then proceed in the cure of him.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And the dislocation of it is known when it is at the parts below by the shoulder joint; so that you distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the intact muscle, for you will see a manifest difference; and you will feel in the head of the muscle concavity and above the shoulder joint from the touch of the head of the muscle as though there were a hole, and the patient cannot reduce his hand to his shoulder, nor move that at all.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If the foot or ankle is dislocated, you will feel a clear bump and it will not be hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And from this dislocation, there is an easier reduction when it is fresh and the patient is a child.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the minister lifts up his hand to the parts above; and then he places his fingers under the patient's chin, and lifts up the joint with strength into its place, and the minister lifts up his hand, and extends that so that it returns more easily.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if it does not return through what we have said, and so from the beginning that the dislocation occurred, after several days, then let the patient be bathed in warm water and let it be anointed with a liniment that softens, just as though his skin were razor-burned, with anise, fenugreek, and melilot in water, and let it be administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And then the patient is laid on his back and a wool pad is placed under his chin, held between elevation and compression, and then the doctor places his heel on the sphenoid bone, and lifts up the top of the muscle with strength, and pulls the patient's hand so that it is not burned at the parts below, and another minister holds the top of the patient's head so that it is not burned at the parts below, for as soon as this is done the joint will return to its place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you wish, reduce it in this manner: and have a man who is taller than the patient stand on that side, and place his hand below the patient's chin and lift up the chin towards the parts above while the patient is suspended in air, and another minister pulls the patient' hand from the parts below his belly.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is light, then let him be suspended by another cause, for the sake of gravity, for the dislocation will return at once.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced in the same manner: and it is that a long pole be placed on the ground, the top of which is round in shape, like a mortar, neither thick nor slender, and then let the patient be placed under it; and then let linen be placed over the pole, and the patient stand according to the length of the pole, and then let his hand be extended towards the parts below the other part; and let his body be extended from the other side with strength, for the joint will return to its place quickly.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if it is difficult to reduce it by all the causes we have said, then use this cure: and it is that you take a pole of two cubits in length, and four digits in breadth, and its thickness is taken from the chin according to this form:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And then over the round head let linen be tied so that the pole does not hurt the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And then let the patient's chin be placed under it, and his hand or arm extended over the pole towards the parts below, and let the pole be tied to the assistant's waist, and his arms and the end of his hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Then let the arm be placed on a rung of a ladder according to its breadth, and the hand extended towards the parts below, and the other body suspended from the other side, for the joint will enter at once.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when its medicine is complete according to whatever way it is possible for you, then let you place under the chin a sponge of equal quantity; and then place plaster prepared from mill-powder with honey and egg white over all the muscle, as though it were rolled upon it, and then press down on the chin with decent tightness; and let the bandage be rolled over the plaster, and his hand be attached to his neck, and let him lie, and not hurt his hand for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And let the food of the patient be reduced a little, while the member is comforted, for it is easier to heal him.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then let his food be increased after seven or five days and let exercise be given to him; and if it is firm and not soft, then he has healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	But if the joint is dislocated many times by moisture that occurs in him or by another cause, then let it be cauterized with three cauteries, as was said before in the chapter on cauteries.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all of this is done and then after seven days the bandage is removed and the joint is not firm, and the plaster and tightness are reduced upon it several times, and it is not firm, and can't raise his arm to the parts above, then know that its nerves which are at the top of the muscle have been cut or extended or made soft, and know that the joint will never be fixed in its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	From the dislocation that is made to the feet and the breast or the back parts, its reduction is done by pushing and extending with hands, as it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And let the other tightness be administered upon it as it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if after the healing the heaviness increases upon the member and the movement of it delays, then let the patient take a bath several times so that this heaviness is eased and he returns to his first nature.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter .XXVII.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	Of the cure of dislocation of the neck.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	Know that the joint of the neck is dislocated with difficulty and returns with difficulty; and it is dislocated to all parts, and especially to the front part more than the back part, and its dislocation is not hidden from you because it hangs down below the shoulder or below the touch according to whatever figure it is dislocated, and when you adjust the neck that is dislocated with the head, this is declared to you manifestly, for the joint is hollowed out and cannot bend the arm, nor touch with that the muscle itself.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And let you know that your neck and reduce the dislocation at once before an abscess comes upon him with a cautery, for if an abscess comes upon him with a cautery, it is difficult to reduce it, and it is not healed of all; and especially when it is at the back parts, for it is the worst of all kinds of dislocation, and of greater pain, and many times they die from that.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of it, when it is possible to reduce, is that his hand be extended with two hands, and his arm be expanded, and the doctor's hands be upon the neck and under him, and he press the joint with the knuckles of his fingers or with the palm of his hand rolled in so that it turns into its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is to the front parts, then it returns so that he bends his hand with his hand, as he pierces the neck with the palm of his hand rolled in.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey the reduction, then administer a strong and violent extension.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And it is that two ministers extend the arm, and hold that joint so that it is not burned by the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And then let the arm be rolled all around as it is wrapped in a folded cloth over his hand, or bandage.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the doctor touches the joint with his hand, let it be anointed with some oil so that it is helped by causes which help in the lubrication of the joint with ease; and then press the joint with strong pressure as it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And then its reduction let it be that the plaster upon which it is placed be stiffened and dried with egg white, and let it be stretched with decent tightness, and his arm suspended from the neck, and let him lie for several days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And then he should be unbound; and if the joint is formed in its place, then you unbind his ligament and leave it.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see that the joint is not stronger, then you repeat the plaster and the ligament, and leave it for a few days until it is strengthened; then unbind it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if there is a heaviness that happens to him in the reduction of the joint, and its disposition is in movement, then administer moisture by bath and subtle friction, compression while he is moved away; or pause over the joint a poultice, if it is a mobile joint; then bind it, and leave it for the day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And then stop that, and put him in a bath; and when he is dry, then you rub the joint with temperate friction, and then repeat on it an ointment, if it is swollen with fluid, once, and the second, and the third day,
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Already corruption has come about the wound' s innermost part, while it is filled with pus.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you want, pause over that split a wet and warmed-up cow's udder with blood and strengthen it over there; and do that several times, because that is wet and returns to its disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter .XXVIII.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	Of the cure for a dislocation of malasan, which is of the joint that is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	Malasan of the hand sometimes is displaced, and the reduction of its dislocation is easier, and the contrary is of the other joints, but however there must be velocity in the reduction of it in the hour in which it is displaced, before that the site is pustularized or pustules happen to it.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of its dislocation is that you place the joint of the patient's hand on a table and him extend his hand, and the doctor places his hand or his palm on the prominence of the joint, and press it in while it returns to its location.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	But however there must be considered if the palm is already turned towards the palm of the hand, then the patient places the back of his hand on a table against the extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is previous to the back of the hand, then the position of the hand of that one intrinically on the table, so that the doctor's hand boxes over that prominence of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And therefore if it returns immediately, it is good; and if not, then strengthen that with plaster yielding the pustule and leave it, and do not repeat it, because otherwise, he will not endure or be able to bear the reduction of it until days have passed over him.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	But however the joint is bent according to its tortuosity; and do not notice to the patient any cause, except that the hand is softened and cannot strengthen anything; then know that the nerves are pinched or cut, and then there is no remedy in him unless it is strengthened with cautery near the place of it and make it strong there is no remedy.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Therefore when the malasan is returned, then pause over it plaster which we have mentioned, and let it be left and strengthened for a few days; then unbind it and let his hand be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if its movement is stopped and there happens to it some heaviness, then soothe that with warm water and friction a few times, until it is moved away.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter .XXIX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Of the cure for dislocation of the thumb.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Sometimes the thumbs are displaced completely apart.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when any of those fingers is displaced to the back of the palm or to its belly, then press and push the displacement of it with your fingers, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	Then support the head of the finger, and suspend that over the part to which it is displaced, and leave it for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	Then suspend that and extend that until it is straightened in that its day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it is morning, loosen that according to that narration, and do not stop unbinding it in the day and exercising with movement, and loosen that in the night; and do that for a few days until it is tight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do that same thing with that if it is displaced to the belly of the hand, and loosen that to that part and do with it its first operation, until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And likewise do with that if it is displaced to the other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter .XXX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	Of the cure for dislocation of the shoulder joints.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When there happens to any of the shoulder joints or the neck a complete dislocation, and they remain only the shoulders out of their places, then in that there is no cure, because death pursues the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And the sign of that is that the digestion of the patient is outside his will, and he cannot retain it; and often times some members of him are softened or two legs of him or two arms of him, or one of those; or one joint is displaced out of its location, because often times there is displacement and the removal of those to four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Then that one is displaced to the back parts and is named luxation.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But its cure is that then you consider if the luxation happens from childhood, because in that there is no cure or of that there is no healing at all.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But in that one which comes from falling or striking against those, then the Ancients gave the manner of cure with prolix speech, of which the most returns with profit; but I and the few excuse the excess of me, because of my proximity to my intention exposing it, with which I have exposed that and spread out that.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say in luxation which happens to the front part in the feet, there is no remedy or healing of that; and likewise in that one which is done to two sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those none is healed except that one which happens in the shoulder precisely with that which I return to it.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And let the patient be extended over his face on a flat surface, and let him be extended under him instrument wet so that he is not bent at the feet of him.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	Then a straight staff be placed, fixed in the ground at the end of the stake around the head of him, and another staff in a hole the feet of him in the other extremity of the stake.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And one minister holds the staff, and it is not fixed in a hole; and another minister has the other according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	Then wrap around the head of the patient and under the tits let them be stretched by a lion-wasp; and extend the end of the band to the staff which is over the head of him, and loosen that in him; then strengthen the other band over the buttocks of him the knuckles of him, and under his legs; then tighten all the bands and loosen those in the other staff which is over the feet of him.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	Then the ministers each extend the band to the end of the staff, and let the two staffs and the bands of their locations in which they are fixed not be displaced, but however do not stop as I have said before.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor pauses his palms over the shoulder with strength until it returns, or let him pause over that a table, and then adjust over the table his feet until it returns.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if it does not return by that form, then take a table of which the breadth or length is in a hole four arms, and a cavity in the wall of which I have said before is near the patient a place into which the end of the table.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then place the middle of the table on the spine, and the doctor places his feet on the other end, and stretch well so that the spine is compressed and returns to its place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you want, open a turn which is twisted by hand; and it is that you place on the ground behind the head of the patient at the height of two fists, the length of which is one arm, and behind his head at the height of two fists; and let the distance between each post be a palm, and now there is made in each post a hole through which the rope passes, and each is firmly fixed to the ground so that it does not move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And there is placed a round post in which is the turn, and it is wound around the two holes of the two posts.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at its end there is a hole through which the post passes, the length of which is a palm where it is wound; and on the other two posts there are similar ones.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	Then stretch the ligaments that you have tightened on the patient's feet in the hole that is behind his head, and the ligaments that you have tightened on his thighs in the turn which is behind his feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	Then place each turn and have an assistant twist the turn with their hand, and the doctor bends the spine as we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the form of the turn:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	Then, after the spine has returned and the place has been greased, you must apply plaster of Paris mixed with egg white, and then stop it; and then place over the plaster a plate of wood whose width is three digits or so, and the length of which is the quantity that takes up the area of the hunchback, and over the spine its thickness.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then it should be bound with ligaments as we have said, and let the patient take subtle nourishment until he is healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if any swelling remains in the area at the end of the healing process, then let potions that soften and smoothen be administered by application of the table for a long time, which we have recounted; and now lead is applied to that place.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And sometimes swelling occurs in the back of the spine, and it is cured by that dislocation; and it is that bone which one should be wary of so that there is no protrusion to him by this medicine, for it will certainly bring about his death.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of the cure for a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the pelvis and the joint of the muscle do not move except by dislocation only, and it does not happen to those which happen to the other joints of slight removal and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the pelvis is dislocated according to four manners, for it is dislocated at its parts within, or at its parts without, or at its parts before, or at its parts behind.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And most often it is dislocated at its parts within, and rarely at its parts before or behind.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of its dislocation at its parts within is that when you touch the leg of the patient with your hand, it is longer and the hip joint is more prominent than the healthy one, and the patient cannot bend his foot due to the tongue-like protrusion, and there is the place where the tongue-like protrusion is pustular due to pustules, so that the head of the thigh has come here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of that which happens to dislocation at its parts without is that his symptoms are contrary to those above.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of that which happens to dislocation at its parts before is that he spreads his leg according to his will, but still cannot bend it without pain where it hurts in the hip; and if he tries to walk and cannot go forwards on the tiptoes of his feet, his urine is retained and there is pustulation where he walks, and he has to walk on his heels.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of that which happens to dislocation at its parts behind is that he cannot spread his hip, or bend it in front of him where he walks; and his leg is shorter than the other, and there is softening of the hip joint, and the head of the thigh protrudes towards that place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	However, the reduction of this dislocation is that you should consider, then, if the dislocation is old and ancient, and it has been aged by having it reduced and remaining according to its condition, then there will be no cure in that; and afterwards there will be no protrusion.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	However, in the one for whom the dislocation is recent, and it is one of the four kinds of dislocation, then you turn to that which he wants and extend it towards its parts within and without, and also to his right and left, for it will return quickly and does not need another cure.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	However, if it does not return in this way, then you should prepare a strong servant and extend the leg of him from the lowest part, or with his hands on top of them over the hip joint; and another servant extends his hand over his anus that puts his fingers below his testicles; and then stretch with ligaments on the root of the thigh, and have another servant hold the end of the ligament.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And let his extension be from the part within towards the ankle, or from the part behind to the part of the chest.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And let all those extensions be in one moment while the patient is elevated by his body from the ground and hanging bent.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this species of extension is common to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And therefore if the dislocation returns as we have said, then it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to all that I will say about the proper cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the proper reduction of it, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is at its parts within, let the patient be placed on his back; and then place the ligaments over the root of the thigh in that place between the head of the thigh and the place below the hip joint; and then stretch the ligament to the highest part of the ankle towards the highest part of the furcula.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And then let another strong servant grab his arms and press the large place of the hip joint and stretch to its parts without by violent extension, for it will return to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this species is the most gentle cure by which that member is reduced more than the other species.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	However, if he is stubborn and does not obey this species of cure by all means, then let his two feet be bound together with strong ligaments, gently, over both heels and both hip joints.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And let the length of each of his parts be the quantity of four digits, and let the leg of him be extended but the other by the quantity of two digits.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And then let the patient be suspended over the head of the post, and let him be in the middle; and let his length from the ground be the quantity of two yards.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And then command a strong young man to press the head of the thigh, and let another young man be suspended by the patient, and the other young man press the thigh with strength, for the joint will return to its place with speed.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	However, in the proper reduction, when it is dislocated to the part without, let him lie on his back according to how we have recommended regarding his hunchback; and let the ligament be tightened over the hip joint properly and over his feet.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And then two sticks are placed, one at the feet and the other at the head; and the sticks are adjusted to the middle of the hip on which dampened cloths are wrapped so that the patient is not harmed by the stick being between their thighs, so that the extension to the parts below is not drawn.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And then each assistant extends to his part, and the doctor has his hand open in the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	So if there is an obstruction and swelling occurs, it will go down significantly; otherwise, apply pressure on it with great care as we have said in the case of a hernia.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But ensure that the patient lies quietly on his back.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And if the dislocation is to the front parts, then ensure that the leg is extended slightly and it will be according to this narrative on the hip; and the doctor places the palm of his right hand over the collar bone of the patient, and then with the other hand he grips it tightly, and with this grip he extends the leg out to the foot at the part of the dislocation.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is to the back parts, then it is not necessary that the patient's leg be extended out, and he must be elevated above the ground; when he is lying on his side with his hip dislocated outwards according to what we have said about his positioning on two sides, and he is on his face and his limbs are extended according to what we have said, then there is no worry.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And it should be administered with pressure using a board over the location of the joint.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	So when the reduction is complete according to what we have said — and the sign of its completion will not be hidden from you, and it is that you extend both legs of the patient, and when you see those signs and the patient stretches out his leg and expands it without any excuse, then you will know that the limb has returned to its proper place — and then you should bring the two thighs together and apply a poultice and bind with a bandage so that the hip is not harmed in either of its parts; and let the patient rest for three or four days.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	Then loosen the poultice and bandage, and compare one leg with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	If you see those signs in full, then know that the dislocation is already closed and then let the patient walk.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause for softening, then return and plaster it, and extend it according to your first extension, and let him be in three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	Then loosen that, and make him delay walking for a few days, until he is comforted.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter .xxxii.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Of the cure of neck dislocation.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The neck is dislocated in three ways: it is dislocated outwards, inside, and to the bottom but not to the front.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of its dislocation is that you command the patient to apply his collarbone with his thigh; then know that the neck is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all of its ways is that you make the patient lie straight, so that he extends his leg if he can on it; adhere two fingers to his face, and place the sole of his foot between your feet; then make someone else extend his leg while the neck returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of its reduction is that his collarbone adheres to his thigh with effortless lifting.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then plaster it and make the collarbone adhere to the thigh, and then bind them together with a bandage for three or four days, and then loosen those.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not use the patient for walking for a few days, until he is healed and comforted.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	But if its reduction is not possible for you, then administer strong extension with the limbs of which in the cure of the hip there is preceding narrative.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter .xxxiii.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Of the cure for dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle is sometimes hurt by small removal, and sometimes it is dislocated according to completion, and its dislocation is done either inside or outside.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of its dislocation is that you see the ankle swollen proceeding to the part to which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But its cure for removal is of slight reduction, and it is extended with ease with hands and is wrapped until it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But in its cure when it is dislocated according to completion, you must make the patient lie straight, and have a strong and valiant minister from behind press him on his hip.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	Then you with your right hand take the highest part of the foot from above, and with your left hand take the lowest part of the foot in the location of the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	Then pull the foot to you with your right hand, and then twice with the left, and extend with the left; and press the sole of the foot with the right because of the collarbone there is work.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do that two times according to what we have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	Then press the sole of the foot on the collarbone the third time, and you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	So if it returns in one or two according to this manner, and you see the foot soft, it is good; otherwise, repeat the operation on it until it does return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if it is prohibited for you to reduce it with what we have recommended, then let the patient lie on his back on earth, and stretch a wooden post in firm earth, and that it be between his thighs, and you have already wrapped a cloth around him so that he does not hurt the patient.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	Then the minister of him has his thighs, and then another minister extends the foot with their hands or with the limb that lies over the collarbone; and each minister extends against the extension of his pair, and the post is extended between the thighs of the patient, so that his body is not drawn to the parts below because of its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	Then the doctor grabs the dislocation with his hands, and another minister has the healthy thigh at the parts below, because the dislocation returns with ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	So when the dislocation returns and you are shown the health of its reduction, then plaster it and extend that with strong limbs, and tie the foot to the collarbone.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And you must be careful or watch out for the nerves which are behind on the ankle, so that the limb over it is not vehement and lead that strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	Then let him be in two or three days; and if the limb is softened, extend that.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	Then loosen that on the third day or fourth, and prohibit the patient from walking for 40 days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if he is forced to walk before that space, it is not certain that the dislocation is not dissolved and ruined, and then that he does not receive cure.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if it happens to him wound blister, then you must minister in the healing of him that in which our narrative preceded, at another location of cure and of fomentation, until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter .xxxiiii.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Of the cure for dislocation of the fingers of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	Let him who is dislocated be greased with a little oil; and that which is not difficult, rather than being easy.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in any bones of the chest, then let him make the patient lie on his back on the ground or a table, and be lying as if he were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	Then you stand on your feet, and place your hand over what protrudes from the joints, and then press that with your foot with strength until it returns, and see that it is greased and there is no protuberance in the location.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then place under the chest of the patient a board which covers the whole chest, to which are two ends, and then tighten that with decent and firm strapping for three days; and then loosen that and let the patient rest from walking for several days, until he is healed and his healing is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the kinds of dislocations that are done with a blow or with a fracture or with any impaction.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of those causes happen to you and you are proficient in the cure of that and in the restoration of him, many times death ensues.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And therefore you should not presume about the cure of him, but let him who is wise in the art, with a long experience, be merciful and compassionate, mild, not hard and presumptuous; and that he use in the beginning medicines which yield apoplexy cauteries only so much, and let the patient trust in divine judgement, except to him by whom you expect salvation from ruin, in the alleviation of the illness, and in which some hope appears.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then try to make him the reduction at the beginning of the cause, before he receives an apoplexy cautery.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the member returns according as we want, then administer a regimen which yields an apoplexy cautery and cures the blow with that which convenes to him of the dry ointments.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is with a fracture and it happens in the separated bones, then you are proficient in their binding, and do in that which we have said in the simple illnesses of that from which they come.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And guard and avoid according to your ability that of the instrument in the ways of fear according as my preaching is preceded to you; for that is better for you to your Creator, and more permanent to your glory, and more salutary to your true body, those in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus end the words of Albucasim perfectly from which God be praised.
Amen.	Amen.
